r0n_EP15m0Eof0Q3Oo-nRA.review_text: If you like men in white suits and gold chains, this is the place to be! It was seriously a weird mix of awesome people and some pimps and hoes. I do not usually judge so it was fun until they changed the music from awesome dance music to just downright ghetto ones. Not cool. Everyone was having fun dancing to tall sasha and the dj's after him until they just had to switch the dj to their resident dj. I just had to leave. I believe this skanky lady had to request this type of music so she can dance like a stripper against the dj booth... trust me.. it looked more like she was scratching her back against it...Certain music attracts a certain type of crowd and I definitely do not want to be a part of a crowd that dances like they need to get a room. Never coming back on a Saturday night.

_RpnAO4fH8Ay8WXZdU-1bQ.review_text: If you're going to Union Square in the evening, stop by the Starlight Room. The décor is interesting and they have a big disco ball in the a dancing area. There was no music when I went most recently. The service was very  courteous and we got a window table. There was actually a plug on the wall so we were able to sneak in a phone charge while we were there, too!  They have a great selection of cocktails that are reasonably priced given the incredible view and location.   I just love stopping in here! Taking in that view and having a cocktail just validates why San Francisco is one of the greatest cities in the world!

TzBKYw3Qqi8SOqV_jX3p3w.review_text: So, considering I came here on halloween  which may be a bit bias considering the place was more packed for an event than usual. I went there that night for a friends combo Halloween/ 30th bday party and the party was too fun. The space is pretty small for the amount of people they packed into the event. The promoters also give discounts for admission to some people but not others even if you are in the same party, so that was lame! For a party of 15, my friend got a table which gave us ladies some breathing space from the small dance floor and sweaty people.   I didn't see any views. All I saw were the surrounding buildings of union square, but maybe I was at the wrong part of the lounge. Overall, music didn't start getting great til half way through when they played classic hip hop tunes that got the people moving.   The costumes were great to see on everyone. It was fun seeing how creative people are. The hostess of our table was gracious and dressed very nicely. She was great at her job.   I'm not sure if I would come here again, without a specific reason like a friends birthday but you got to try everything once, right?

86PRyfTGtEI4Ne7yxdtw7Q.review_text: I came here with colleagues. We were in town for the night for business and Harry Denton's was recommended by the concierge at our hotel.   When we came in the host did not give us a friendly welcome whatsoever. I was trying to ask him if an area near the bar we were interested in sitting was open for self-seating, but he basically cut me off and said he would seat us in another area. So, I had to ask him again and he finally told us that we couldn't sit there. All the while, no smile and very unwelcoming as if we were annoying him with our presence.   We asked him if food was still being served and he said yes.   We were seated and given one menu for three people.   The waitress, however, was a breath of fresh air--friendly and welcoming.   She took our drink orders while we were looked over the menu. It took us a couple minutes to figure out what we wanted because nothing especially popped out.   Finally, we made a decision and got the waitress's attention and let her know we wanted to order food. She told us the kitchen was closed!! Of course, we were quite surprised because we had been told otherwise by the grumpy host. We asked if there was anything we could be served--bread and butter so we wouldn't be drinking on an empty stomach??? After all, the kitchen would had to have just closed in the 10 minutes or so from when we came in to when we tried to order.   She said she would go an check and let us know.   A while later she happened to come by our table and we had to remind her that she was supposed to be checking with the kitchen for us and she confirmed that there was nothing they could serve us and said that she would bring us the check and hurried off.   My colleagues and I looked at each other a bit confused, because we never indicated that we wanted the check, but we were like, whatever--we're not having another round anyway.   When guests are seated right before the kitchen closes, any good server would ask them if they wanted to put in an order before the kitchen closes. I don't know why she didn't bother asking us.   Meanwhile, the waitress was back and forth and never brought us the check. Finally, we asked her about it and she brought it to us. I was thinking perhaps she realized the she had prematurely offered the check to us and changed her mind about bringing it--then again, she could have just forgotten about it.   I must admit, she was overextended--she seemed to be taking care of the entire lounge until another waitress came on not long before we left. So, she had about 7 tables.   The drink was good, so no complaints there.   The decor was hideous. The upholstery desperately needs to be redone. It is worn and tattered.   The crowd was a random mix.   The DJ was great! Hip hop and top 40s.   The view is really nice.   Only because of the view, I would say that it isn't terrible if you just want a drink and a great view and you know what you're getting yourself into.

i6KYRuZIFAKv56GmuRhxaQ.review_text: I went for Sunday's A Drag and it was FABULOUS!   The performers were all excellent - Cassandra Cass was TO DIE FOR in her Jessica Rabbit dress. The MC was very good and overall the ladies were all extremely entertaining and funny.   The buffet was also quite good - there was a good variety of food including an omelette bar and a carving station. The drink specials of the day were also very good - definitely old-timey and fit the vibe of the Starlight Room perfectly.  The views were beautiful even though the sun shades were down. It was really nice to be able to see the city from so high up.   I thoroughly enjoyed myself as did the party I went with. We will definitely be returning as this was one of the most enjoyable and entertaining afternoons we have had!

F5M02eIaxcjD_OyFQxmM6w.review_text: We went to the Starlight Room for their drag brunch. It was fun!  The food was good; lots of variety and good quality. Make sure you show up a little early; we got there right before the show, and barely had time to fill our plates before the entertainment started.  I think I saw my first drag show in the early 80's. I've been to a lot of them. The performers for this show were excellent. The hostess had an elegant Olympia Dukakis thing going and sang her own numbers. I really enjoyed her. The performers were gorgeous and really interacted a lot with the crowd.   It was a tourist's drag show, though; pretty clean and not particularly campy. I'm rather fond of amateur, chubby older drag queens with a little chest hair peeking out and a great sense of humor. This was definitely not that kind of drag show. These gals were just gorgeous.  Our server was a lovely little thing; she was very welcoming and attentive.   We had a really nice time. We just about fell over when we got the bill; this is not an inexpensive brunch! We had such a good time, though, we didn't mind the expense.  If you have friends in town, particularly straight friends who want to do something that's a little outrageous and fun, this brunch is a good place to take them.

xoNPKyNUflSBrk86HBthvw.review_text: Two drink minimum per guest per table. Our blonde snooty waitress was kind enough to remind us repeatedly. She wouldn't even bring glasses of water unless we ordered drinks.  She then got an attitude when we closed the bill without buying all 18 drinks. We had a party of 9 people. Two of them couldn't or didn't want to drink for one reason or another (designated driver, pregnant). Other than the blonde waitress's nasty demeanor. The music was great. The drinks were made well. All the other staff there were very helpful. From the man that checked id's, to the coat check lady, to the maitre d, to the bartenders.  I've been here several times and never encountered such a rude waitress.   So the low star rating is purely based on her service.   I'll be back but won't be getting a table...

NZN0XXLiMJPSm_A2Wav_bg.review_text: Experienced Sundays a drag today! Fabulous...and my daughter Madellyn enjoyed it well. Food was good but the performers are what made it great! Lots of energy and great performing! I'm now a fan!

OG1NrYwCdlARzD4Qgssz7Q.review_text: A late cold rainy night. . . so we duck into the Sir Francis Drake in all it grandeur.  We were not dressed in blazer and gown but the door man was really cool and let us in. Live Jazz and a very eclectic mix of people. The Drinks were a bit pricey but very well made.   But not our scene. Cool if you are older or want to hang with older folks. Oh yeah it was a Tuesday evening.....We heard they have a pretty good DRAG show . . . maybe we will check that out next time.

bpgbVPJcG-wQ4cNBcPPIxw.review_text: Sundays a Drag Baby!! Well not at the Starlight! It's a Sunday's Brunch & a Drag show! Holla!  Was in the Bay Area and wanted to do something fun for my birthday,  so went to Sundays a Drag down at the Starlight Room, made reservations for the 2:30pm show, seating for the brunch started at 1:30 and they do serve brunch up to 30 mins into the show.  I was pretty excited to combine 3 of my favorite things, my birthday, brunch and drag show all in one day, knew this had to spectacular.  Let's dish!   1st up the food:  I felt fancy so I had to get the Waldorf salad darling because everyone is having it, and it was great, in fact I forgot how much I loved it. Also tried the Eggs Benedict, they tasted good, egg was cooked perfectly but they were sparely on the hollandaise sauce, man I love that golden yellow sauce, don't hold back!  I also tried the chicken and waffle, a veggie omelet, a truffled deviled egg, some roasted red potatoes, a scone with sweet butter & jelly, maybe a lil chocolate & dark chocolate cake and some chocolate covered strawberries DON'T JUDGE! It was my birthday damnit and I was starving haha.   To drink, had water, coffee and a Bellini, the Bellini was perfect, went well with brunch.   The show was great, I enjoyed it, there were 4 acts all together, and everyone did a great job. I loved the outfits; saw a few that I should flaunt haha. Just a great show for a Sunday afternoon. I would come back to Sundays A Drag in a heartbeat!   After the show they opened up the curtain and allowed us to just enjoy the view, just so beautiful checking out the city views.

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: This is pretty old school place. Definitely not my scene but can see why it has been a Wednesday night staple. This is a hotel lounge that sits on top of the Sir Francis Drake hotel so the view of the city is quite fly. There are a bunch of lounge tables throughout the room with a main bar as you walk in. There are other makeshift bars and a small dance floor towards the back. Crowd is interesting and seems more like tourists. Can be a romantic experience if you're a little bit older in age.

46ohdPOyBDDxw7UOhItc8g.review_text: I think "The Starlight Room" deserves 5 Stars,  Great view of the city! Good drinks & a nice selection of appetizers. And how could i forget, Good Music! With a live DJ / Band certain nights.

gxL0vm3nJCWcW1WgY4HA8Q.review_text: This place was just alright .. I mean it's on the top of the building of the Sir Francis Drake hotel and looking over the city, but if ur a bit older then me this lounge is perfect.. It's like a midlife crisis exploded up there.. Music was really good but just a very older crowd

QMSlNf7r2AYVOZRDfV8Gzw.review_text: This place gets 4 stars for ambiance and decor. Atop the Sir Francis Drake Hotel, the hotel is gorgeous, and once inside Starlight, the views from the venue were . My only concern is accessibility. Leave the venue before the rush or you'll be waiting for a while.   There were a lot of out-of-towners the day that I went. Music was good. Overall pretty good night out.

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: I believe I tweeted, "Brunch, cocktails, and drag queens performing 'I touch myself' Happy Sunday to me!" following Sunday's a Drag brunch at Harry Denton's Starlight Room. It's a decent brunch selection with a made-to-order omelet station. (yelp.com/biz_photos/LzE0…) The buffet included eggs Benedict, salads, breakfast sausage & bacon, smoked salmon, deviled eggs, roast beef, pastries, fruit and more. (yelp.com/biz_photos/LzE0…) Coffee, tea, and juices are also included but you should probably grab a cocktail before the show. It is a really fun experience and a nice way to spend a weekend. The jokes can be slightly naughty but tame by regular drag show standards so first-timers need not worry. Just bring your sense of humor and an open mind and let the girls entertain you. (yelp.com/biz_photos/LzE0…) All in all, Sunday's a Drag is good clean fun that is also just oh so San Francisco. I mean come on... brunch, cocktails, and drag queens performing "I touch myself." Happy Sunday to me!

kOadQdLhZJaX5qY6RWMUPQ.review_text: Watch out for the bartenders here. They're shady as hell. I ordered $36 worth of drinks and they "preemptively" charged me for $50 as if I was some dumbass tourist. Who does that?! ONE STAR FOR YOU.

851VDFg0EozK3pqzkyUOOQ.review_text: This review is for New Year's Eve.  Harry, you devil.

y_jl-bErj1mnb4KF04F74Q.review_text: Great live and dj music - a fine night out w/ a group or a date - just dance! Fun drag show Sunday brunch, too.

BfKWT0TdVJPc39og4qRvJw.review_text: Love the view and classy:) love my cocktail too! We went there last friday night for our friends birthday lilibeth shout out for her !!we had different kinds of cocktail serve best mixes taste ever,really just good for the night. lots of giants fan and KC came too!Thanks to Kendra she's very nice and excellent service we all had a great night!everybody is friendly:)

tObANvYP7V66eA5fAyGqbg.review_text: SF spot that you have to go to at least once in your lifetime! I love what they've done to the place, it's much nicer than the old Starlight room. The food is....hmmm... to be expected for a hotel on Powell St. - it's OK! Not saying it's bad but I just wasn't "Wowed" that's for sure. But honestly, let's get to the real reason I go here... That AMAZING view of my beautiful city!! It really is breathtaking and having a cosmo with my girls, listening to top 40s feel good music, atop a downtown somewhat swanky (work with me here) hotel, staring out into the BEST CITY in the world (clearly I'm a native) - you just can't beat that w/ a bat! :)   I'll likely come back again if I have to take out fam or friends from out of town... like I said, you just have to see it at least once in your lifetime!

wr1Y8-yLVCoaDKR4ihiTGg.review_text: There comes a time in everyone's life when signs of old age are unwittingly bequeathed upon us. We notice this when our joints begin to creek, muscles hurt for no particular reason, and a game such as bowling or softball leaves us sore for days. When this time arrives, most of us tend to sigh and admit defeat while others feverishly deny it by saying "I used to be able to (Insert amazing feat of superhuman abilities here)." Your crows feet do not lie. Being able to do something in the past admits you can't perform the same thing now. You're old. And you go to the Starlight Room. The music varies from 70s-80s to hip hop, trip hop, rock, and lounge music. Everything can be played except any music above 80 bpm which would undoubtedly explode any hearing devices some patrons wear and cause hip replacement surgery cases  to sky rocket. Proof this place is old? During Wednesday night Indulgence, the fire department is there partaking in the festivities wearing full uniform. You can't fool me. Underneath that jacket hides a defribillator. I see the hump. And those lovely lady lumps from the Go-Go dancers. youtube.com/watch?v=LgLC… I even took a video because one day I'll be too old to remember what I had for lunch. A varied crowd from the freshly graduated "I want to grow up but can't really afford the $10 vodka/cranberry" to the "I need a cane to get to the dance floor" comes mixed in a unique combination of random chaos theory. The great thing is that it works. Everybody's got a place in the Starlight Room. The 3 room areas are spacious, the view from the top of the Sir Francis Drake is breathtaking, and during the holiday season, Macy's lightshow is visible and adds to the ambiance by reflecting cool Christmas light patterns off the disco ball. That is, if can remember it...

59XuKFMlnZkS6uqHeclouw.review_text: The Red Lobster of nightclubs.  This is the only "club" that Matt will consider going to and I don't go clubbing without hubby, so I'm between a rock and hard place.  More cheese than a large pizza.  Whateva -- I have Wii Dance Revolution if I want to party!! LOL!!

x3NsAlkSGb2hvd8XcvzFQw.review_text: Rarely do I write a one star review, but when I do, the one star is surely warranted.   Long story short, we came here as an "after party" to a wedding. The bride had pre-paid for all of us to gain entrance, and we were all given wrist bands. Apparently the people who sold the wrist bands had not communicated with the incompetent "bouncer" manning the entry on September 20, 2014.   As guests of the wedding poured out of the elevators, all wearing wristbands, this "bouncer" proceeded to swear at us, using incredibly rude and foul language, and humiliate us. There is never a reason to swear at a customer.  Hey dude, did you ever think to speak nicely to guests or ask management what was going on? Guess not.   About 30 minutes later we were finally let in, turns out the wristbands were pre-paid! Oops! They made a mistake, no apology was offered.   We proceed to go in and sit down and unmarked tables, ready to order drinks. We saw other tables marked reserved, so obviously didn't sit at those. Another incredibly rude staff member stomps over, treats us like 10 year old children, yelling at us to get up and move. The flippen BRIDE on her WEDDING NIGHT was sitting there, but still yelled at and made to move, no reason given. (?)  After that, I chose to leave. No place that treats me like that is going to get any of my $. I just feel bad for my friend, the bride, who had a gorgeous and amazing wedding prior to the Starlight Room. She shouldn't have to put up with that kind of crap on her wedding night, especially when she had previously pre-paid for her wedding guests to gain entry.   I would rather have my eyeballs gouged out with a hot metal spoon than return here.

cJCYCEfDL4n5TgU9y8RTWg.review_text: You know, as weird as this may seem, I actually find this place a bit catchy. Yes I'm a fan of this club. First off, you take this nice walk up the Sir Francis Drake steps to the lobby. Here you encounter a mini lounge bar just to start things off I guess? Then you take the elevator 21 stories up to the very top. Wala! You're here at Starlight.   Punch in your ID and you're in. The first thing I noticed was the nicely old fashioned yet glamorous bar. It looked like it flew out of an opera scene. Then I walked around with tabled here and there, rich white folks socializing, company parties late at night, and then I see the dance floor. The view is amazing from here! The best view of Powell and some parts of Union Square.   The crowd wasn't my type though. It seemed like a cult gathering full of rich folks. The DJ was ok. He played some good music. The lighting is dark and it sets the mood for lounging here. I'm actually thinking about gathering some people of mine and chillin up here for a bit. I kinda like this atmosphere?! LOL

yddl4fiufL2q311OPlwJbQ.review_text: This would be 5 stars if they got rid of the karaoke wanna be's lounge act they had on Friday nights back in November when we were there! Robert and Michael are angels! They made our night memorable! Please do your establishment a favor and keep your DJ gainfully employed! Other than that our party of 8 had a total blast!  Definitely worth checking out if you are 30 plus.

h9unlpk_s18jhml22Jt6aQ.review_text: I've been here to dance in the evenings and brunch with the drags in the afternoon. Can't really tell you which crowd I like better. Both are awesome in their own way.   Did you know they'll kick you out if you are sleeping? Yep, we got kicked out (deservedly so) because my drunk blond couldn't stay up. Prior to that, we had some strong drinks and a spin around the dance floor. Fun, fun, fun.

KJ_0tYPk3VeoNun0s4RkBA.review_text: Oh, you know. Just another normal Saturday night for me and a few of my girlfriends. What to do...? What to do...?  What else? Go to Harry Denton's Starlight Room!?!?  Well, we thought it was funny and more than anything, random. Walking through the Sir Frances Drake, I felt like a tourist. Upon walking into da lounge, we were promptly seated. Music was booming- think, fun dance wedding music. I did appreciate the band's coverage of Earth, Wind & Fire and Michael Jackson songs. Rock on! It's very dark inside and I must say, the furniture is nothing luxurious (booths and chairs were ripped, old and worn), but the view....ahhh the View!  The view of San Francisco is beautiful. You gotta go to Harry's at least once, just to see the view.  The drinks were decent- I recommend the Napa Crush. The service was okay, however, I did not appreciate how the waitress charged our friend's credit card on file for the entire table's drinks prior to showing us an itemized receipt (seriously, WTF).  It's touristy. But it's worth a visit, at least once. On a clear night.

1o8osR2eL3HlrWbKO3lUUw.review_text: Know first that this *is* going to be a pricey venture.   I'm guessing that if you can't  afford it, that's by design - just stepping off the elevator of the 22nd floor, you know this is a classy joint.   Your first hint might be the beautiful creatures in elegant black evening gowns who greet you.   Perhaps it's the dramatic, smooth style of decor that in this place, on this floor, sinks you into a Casablanca mood, but in any other setting would look tacky and garish.     If nothing else tips you off, the menu will.   But you're not coming here to drink or to get drunk, or at least you shouldn't be.  If you are, you're missing the point.   Come here to dance, come here to see the view, come here for the caramel gelato... but mostly, come here to be a part of the atmosphere.

tac_Kc8jf6Vp68DVjPMhxg.review_text: Great views, great drinks and great people. Michael has to be the best manager of any lounge/nightclub I have been to. He and his staff know how to go above and beyond to service their guests. They took a bleak looking night and turned it into a night to remember. Thanks all at Starlight!

6S-NbThL4mgbBN2BFwNAew.review_text: I recommend the "Cable Car" cocktail, a special cocktail design and invented by the world famous Bar Chef Tony Abou-Ganim. In the San Francisco, Harry Denton and his clubs are an institution This place has is no different, it has wonderful city views, great atmosphere and ambiance.  The service is incredible, the Bar Chef's are professionals and make outstanding cocktails. The staff is gracious and accommodating.

gmAIKkmru-gBAEMkSQky2Q.review_text: I was here on a Saturday night, 2 weeks ago with my girlfriends and we had an amazing time. Yes, I agree with everyone that the drinks  & food were expensive but hey, it was my BFF's birthday, so it didn't matter.  We enjoyed the live band, can't remember the name of the band but they sang mostly hits from the 70s, 80s, and 90s.  Great view of Union Square at night and the hotel it's located in is very beautiful.  I think this is a great place to go have a drink with friends, listen to music, and go dancing. It does cater to a more mature crowd from what I saw that night but there were people of all ages there.  I am really looking forward to going back!

jTXtSuXT-1CMPzEk-Mvtzg.review_text: A night out on the town lead us to the Starlight Room.  Easy parking across the street; always nice when a gal is dressed up and wearing her heels! It was easy to find and the building has an old school San Francisco quaint charm with plenty of style.  We had a reservation and got a nice booth. The host was so charming and sweet! What a doll! The table service was not bad for a nightclub that was pretty busy, we got there at about 9:30.  The drinks were good and strong and the apps. were also tasty. We had the deviled eggs(creamy and crunchy with the bacon on top), prawn cocktail(classic large prawns with yummy spicy cocktail sauce), and the crab cakes(crunchy and well seasoned). My favorite was the ambiance and the mix of people. The cocktail gals were all dressed in their classic sexy all black dresses and were beautiful. The view was great and the DJ was playing a nice variety of music. There is also a coat check if your so inclined.

w0OivdKTZdNrYO0mUGAjQQ.review_text: Ducked in here for a drink to see the view on a weekday night.   Didn't pay a cover, did buy a glass of wine.  It was good.  There was a disco ball and a big view of union square park.  Both cool things.    This place has a very cool old hollywood vibe.  it's fancy, and a place you go to be fancy.  I wouldn't spend all night here drinking, but I would tell someone to go here and grab a drink if they are in the city.

K-yij8EBuF2wzk22BDVAIw.review_text: Cocktails are overpriced, but the view is fantastic. The music is really cheesy but fun for dance parties with all girls.

rqIoGREECusC54Dsblvb4w.review_text: Perfect for dancing!  My mom's friend was visiting from Canada and wanted to go dancing, so I looked up placed on yelp and settled on this. I'm so glad I did. We arrived on a Friday night around 9pm and they didn't charge us a cover.  We parked for free on Bush and Powell, right by the Stockton garage (which was only $8 for the night).  Almost all the tables were reserved but somehow we managed to get a great booth near the dance floor and band. It's a really cool atmosphere with comfortable seating and really great music. My mom is 60, her friend is 50, and I'm 35 (all women), and the variety of ages in the club was perfect for us. Ages ranged from 21 to 70, with most people in their 30s and 40s, I'm guessing.  The ethnic makeup was a nice variety of white, asian, black and hispanic. The crowd was okay looking, not bad, though if I was single I might have been disappointed.  The music was really impressive - the live band played a lot of great 70s music, nice variety (of 70s plus other decades, including the recent "Crazy") with lots of energy for dancing.  The singer was awesome - he sounded like Stevie Wonder,  great range, style and tone. He was also great with the audience, moving around occasionally, made lots of eye contact, plus he's hot.  The guitarist and tenor saxophone player both played lots of incredible solos (effective melodic builds and structure, great music references, tons of energy), and both were also great supporting players. The keyboardist and drummer really kept the music moving well, and the keyboardist has a nice voice for backups and lead vocals.  The DJ spun great tunes for dancing (the live band and DJ traded off).   The dance floor is a great size, at times filled and sometimes empty, but never made me feel crowded or self-conscious (a few people sitting can see the dance floor, but if you don't want to be watched, no problem finding a spot). Some men asked all of us to dance at various points in the evening (we stayed past midnight), but none of them became persistent, so that added to the experience.  I wouldn't go here to meet someone as a single person, but it's perfect for couple and those who just want to have a great time out, drinking and dancing (and if someone in your party doesn't want to dance, there's no pressure with the way it's set up - my mom sat in the booth for much of the night).  The host, Robert, and our waitress were both very attentive, friendly and efficient. We had drinks when we wanted them, and were not pressured to buy more when we were finished. We also felt safe to leave our belongings at the booth unattended, but I also brought my purse to the dance floor because their is a shelf on the edge where you can place drinks and belongings - perfect. The view is incredible, most of the night I felt like I was dancing with San Francisco.  The bathrooms are also nice and I never had to wait. The live music was piped in, too, which I appreciated.  The drinks were tasty. I ordered a Devilish (very light and refreshing, nice girly drink) and a Napa Crush (tasted more like alcohol, still sweet and delicious). My mom ordered a martini (thumbs up) and a Brambo (I think that was the name, it was really good with sweet and sour flavors). Her friend ordered two Cherry Bombs, which she obviously liked (less sweet than my drinks, good for both men and women).  All drinks were $10 each, except the martini ($10.50).

bW2LMBS-D-qAgXfpeof3UQ.review_text: First time I've been here so I have nothing to compare with to how it was before.  But the view is AMAZING! You can see the entire downtown SF area. Gorgeous red and gold walls with velvet booths and chandelliers galore.  Very classy.  Cant give this a good review because one...they use pisco for their drinks and its a bit on the sweet side for me. I did enjoy the Glenfidditch tasting tho. I could've given a review for the food, but honestly I didn't have any!!!  All I had was a little cube of watermelon with a hot pepper on it.  Thats it!  They needed more tray passers. They had more waiters coming out to collect glasses than to serve food.  If this reflects the service at this place....I think I'll pass for now.

2844knqT5JznVAJqiDVyBw.review_text: I really was digging this place. The ambiance was romance and maturity and sexiness all at once. Came here for a cocktail with the beau after a nice dinner. The drink was fabulous. More on the expensive side. There was a dance floor with a few brave souls (it was on the earlier side). My only complaint was the DJ. Definitely room for improvement in that area. I'd go back again.

OIjzXPIALLmOyXNk1CahDg.review_text: Santa here!  I visited the lounge Friday and Saturday night to check out what all my elves were raving about.  Wow!  The place is classy, like the old style lounges of 50 years ago. I was impressed by Derick the manager and all of the beautiful staff.   Most of the guest come dress to the nines, which of course, added it's charm all the more.  Two birthday parties, 100 photos and a few drinks, plus dance, dance and more dancing - Santa was happy.   Go there and enjoy life.  Merry Christmas!  Santa .

uzdUXO3OPI2Czt14aUrDvg.review_text: Despite what you might hear, Harry's actually has a young crowd.  That is, if you go on the right night.  On Wednesday nights, 20 to 30 somethings take over the Starlight Room lending a youthful vibe an old San Francisco staple.  From waiters in tuxes to dolled up divas, you can put on your best dress and not feel the least bit over done, even in the middle of the week. Harry's takes you back to a glamorous era, before designer jeans and $100 sneakers existed. If you're the type of person who loves to dress up, but never has the right place to wear over-the-top attire, this is it!   Dance the night away atop Union Square and see what makes the Starlight Room a true icon!

plY-YHJtnPPdZhfQnw49mA.review_text: The dj is great there, the view were great but the crowd was just not exactly what I m used to. I feel like a little too tourist there and a bit older than I thought it would be. The place was great but not quite for me and my friends. I always see the light from union square and always wonder how it is up there. I wouldn't mind coming again if I have the right people with me.

uXybf-Hg0cpCHj8i7C2lIQ.review_text: The night view on top of St Francis Drake Hotel was brilliant. The club ambiance is classy. Love the cocktails and food, and price is not too crazy as expected in a hotel like Drake.   Would love to come back!

3xsmXxDysn5yqflq3AzWKQ.review_text: I had been to the Starlight Room once on a visit to San Francisco, but hadn't been back since moving here.  I came here for some after-work drinks and appetizers on a Friday night, rolling in around 6:30 before the place started getting really busy.  The host gave us a great table looking out to the western parts of the city; at 20 or 30 floors above the city streets, there really aren't any bad seats in this place, but this one was particularly nice.  We ordered some speciality cocktails.  My wife got the "Old Havana," the Starlight Room's take on a Mojito.  I enjoyed a Partida Margarita with plenty of salt.  We also ordered the "Mezze" plate, which included a very tasty hummus along with pita bread, olives, radishes, and tomatoes.    The staff was particularly courteous and we were not disappointed with our drinks and food.  Overall, 4 stars for this downtown establishment!

A_BT4EcxzNj-vNXlefXOPA.review_text: Interesting place. Went there on a Wednesday night, it was crowded because of an event that was happening nearby. Mature crowd, didn't see many college-like kids.   Excellent view, especially at night ( hence starlight room!)  It's located at the top floor of a hotel. The dance floor is small, but had great surround view of the city.  Plenty of seats and tables for those who want to chat with friends, rest, have a small bite. It's not a typical clubby place, i like having the option of being able to find a seat easily, and not being disturbed there as a female.  Bar staff was nice, cocktails were great, typical drink prices at place like this. Overall nice experience. Go for the view at least once! I think it'll be a nice place for holding a birthday celebration.

S-pogcHooYAxJl51ZC5l6w.review_text: If you live in the area, you've probably been thinking about going to the drag brunch forever and just never seem to get around to it. I finally I did, because it was for Easter brunch and I finally had the day off.  I've been to alot of drag dining and I'd say its pretty safe to say you come more for the show than the food. But the food was great. Brunch buffet, everything was super tasty and good assortment. Food for the whole fam. But again, the food is just there to absorb the mimosas while you are being entertained by these lovely ladies.  Donna Sachet and her crew put on an amazing show. At some points I was cry-laughing and some points just being in awe at how gorgeous these girls are. Loved every bit of it.  GO.... take some out of towners and a sense of humor and an appetite for champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries.

GLo8rwIC0lhVSsG0s8p4tA.review_text: I've only been here once on vacation on a Tuesday night and it was the PERFECT place to catch a drink with a great view of the city. The staff was incredible and very attentive. Drinks were tasty. The atmosphere is very old money feeling with comfy booths and thick window drapery which was a nice change of pace from all the ultra modern lounges that seem to be popular today.  I only regret not coming here on a Wednesday or Sunday. Maybe next time!

NdAHXPry1Sj0mrzuCywcDQ.review_text: Only thing that bumped this up from a 2 star to 3 star is the location. What a view! The insides look posh and there are usually hot girls(paid working girls) here (and a few real hotties), but over all it's more of a ghetto fabulous wannabees. Really the music is really last decade news and most djs don't transition that well. Burlesque dancers in the lounge area are hot! The vibe's more a poser and wannabee crowd. Drinks are expensive and really you feel like you get stuck in a small space. And you don't want to leave because the cover was so expensive, plus to get to another venue takes effort going down stairs and walking around to the nearest club. If you've got a tourist in town who's never been here or seen the city take them here. If you want to have a good time without feeling like you're just watching your wallet drain away come here.  Really though. What an awesome view!

c8jo-_rquR2In4jubJC7Dw.review_text: I just had an awesome time at the "Sunday's a drag" brunch and drag performance   The food was pretty good and included a prime rib carving station and omelets  to order. Salads and eggs Benedict were yummy. There was also a lot of fruit and even chocolate covered strawberries.   Now to the performers: Miss Tia was my favorite.  Her eye makeup was fantastic.  I wish I could do something that glamorous.   Our mc Donna Sashay was so hilarious ! And she sings so well. Part of her act is to talk about the conference for forensic toxicologists. It's supposed to be random but I actually get emails about that conference!!

tXKTfiUh_3R1En0xYonXdw.review_text: If I ever need someone rubbed out by a guy named Ivan, I now know where to come.  It's only when you actually see them together that you realize that Russians and Persians are destined by Almighty God to party together.  Never before have I seen so much chest hair, 4-carat gold-plated neck gear, or bootleg Armani/DG. gear.  I did, however, appreciate the opportunity to pay $15 for a martini.  You don't get that option every night.  Lots of deep pile red carpet, too.  I anticipate that's so that they don't have to do much cleaning after Ivan the Iceman gets shanked at his table.

eAof6W9IJw0KM9Na6hx5qg.review_text: THIS PLACE IS REALLY FUN,  the only downt thing is that the drinks at the bar are pretty expencive, but is really fun.the view is amazing. THIS IS THE TYPE OF PACE THAT A COUPLE SHOULD GO. IT WOUNT B FUN GOING SOLO.

77Qa_ftGGDtTY7Ui3BFpiA.review_text: Fun band and pretty view. I would love to order one of their punch bowls but I don't have that many friends to drink it with!

t-PmN1OFRTLE0B3xa20HXQ.review_text: Came here on a Saturday night around 10pm and the line wasn't very long so I thought the place wasn't that busy, WRONG. Once we made it up the elevator to the 21st floor we saw how many people there actually were.  We waited in another small line where our ID was checked and luckily didn't have to pay the cash cover since we were on a guest list. Thanks Sebastian! This place is gorgeous! I definitely felt fancy as we were walked over to the table where he had bottle service. Everyone that worked here were all dressed very classy and had great customer service skills, checking back often to see if we needed anything.   The starlight room has a great view of downtown. It looked beautiful as all the buildings outside were lit up against the dark foggy sky. I'm sure it's equally as beautiful around dinner time here. There are plenty of tables and seating that are reserved for bottle service. The dance floor is a little small so I'd definitely recommend getting a table with a group of friends. Otherwise you'll be stuck on the dance floor the whole night where it started to get really hot and cramped. Around 11 it was so hot the windows were fogging up and you could no longer see outside.   I've read that there's generally an older crowd here but on this night there was a good mix of younger and older.  It was a lively crowd and the music was good. The DJ played top 40 and that's what I like!

PfpRvMAESbC2bC8FUIMdNg.review_text: This place is definitely a tourist destination with great views. The ambiance is interesting. I felt like I was walking into a swanky bar from the 60s. The drinks are good, but a little pricey. They have a $5 cover after a certain time in the evening. The music they played the night I was there was mainstream. It was fun watching the 40-50yr olds dance to it, they were pretty good lol.

RAVo9jp8D6dFiuBzy_ywXA.review_text: The bouncer at the door was really nice. He says that it mainly depends on who's near the bar. If there's young people, most likely a lot of the younger crowds go in, but if there's an older crowd, then older crowd go in. Also, cover is based on how packed the room was. We went there at 9 ish and it was pretty dead ($5 for cover). People were still having dinner. I was starving so we went out for food hoping that it gets happening at 12 ish.   On the way back we saw three girls walk by ready for the fun night out but to realize that they were just leaving...and my friend and I was like if they're leaving, upstairs must really suck. And yes, it did! but we made the best of it.  I mean at some points it was good towards 1 o'clock. The crowd was very mixed. There was even a wedding and there was bunch of cliques (meaning more than 4 people) and not couples. Probably partying it up after work (since it was a Friday).   The music was mostly 90s. Not a lot of current top hits and I swear the DJ couldn't mix since he played the whole song from beginning to end. The view is nice though, you can see Union Sq from the top, but that's about it.

9J1xGTCIzczJmDzrHTk0fw.review_text: First things first, everything in Downtown SF is EXPENSIVE, especially for a grad student looking for some fun. But if you know me you know that empty pockets wont stop me from gettin giggy with it, yeah, I just said that. So, I went to Starlight with a couple of hotties on a Wed night. The DJ was sick and the crowd was pretty mixed. Everything from your low-end douches to your Suit's were getting down and dirty on the dance floor. The women... well let just say that my eyes were wide open all night, hard thing to do for an Asian.   Getting right to it... The music was good, but it was a Wed night not sure what they play on other nights. The girls were plentiful and the crowd was all about having fun. The down side is as is everyplace DT San Francisco is the high admission charge and cost of drinks.   All in all it was a good time. But I'm a firm believer that its the people you're with and not the venue that makes a good time.

UqkrP5O2ToeXRcYbp7okIA.review_text: I've been here a couple times now. There is a lot to love about Harry Denton's starlight room-- It's almost like a historical landmark of San Francisco.. with an awesome view of the city and Union Square. The lounge is draped with red curtains, that appear to be straight outta the 70s and there are typically plenty of places to sit, as well as tons of space on the dance floor to move around. Either there has been a dj playing music or a live band playing music every time-- this last dj on Wednesday night was okay. I don't know if I would ever plan a whole entire evening at this lounge, but it always a fun place to stop on a night around town. ;-)

_GDtwyFtI8EYlddRo3qq4A.review_text: Went to the Sunday's a Drag brunch this past weekend. The brunch was amazing and the show fantastic!  Anything you would want in a brunch they had.  Everyone is able to see the stage. a great value for the price. Performers interact with audience.

BOU25_BWQnLdFJBKUe2XdQ.review_text: Came here with a group last night and I was bored before I paid $15 cover. Starlight is a lounge area on the top floor of the Sir Francis Drake, a design which really needs to be remodeled.   The place is a mixture of Peppermill that once was in Daly City and The Cafe which is a gay club in the Castro. Once one walks in there is a large bar on ones left and coat check and restrooms on the right. Walking in further is tables filled with people eating. So if your here for food, your going to have a bunch of people walking around you trying to squeeze into a tiny dance floor. And if you are hear to dance, your dancing to 80's music on a tiny little dance floor.   Just the combination of a restaurant and dance floor in a dilapidated decor isn't that bad when your talking about a small room to begin with. But to charge people a $15 cover just to do so is outrageous.

SF0d8N7Tob6my62wbIHSxQ.review_text: Amazing view!!! Awful drinks. If a bartender can't even make a good vodka tonic, there are issues. If you go, order wine and enjoy the great views!

-K2Tcgh2EKX6e6HqqIrBIQ.review_text: I came to the Sunday's a Drag brunch recently with some friends to celebrate a special occasion. The show was a lot of fun and the food was pretty good, but we didn't appreciate the waitresses trying over and over to get us to buy their overpriced drinks. I had wanted an iced tea and they told me they didn't have any. Oh, come on! This is a hotel with several restaurants.   Well, an iced tea was miraculously procured abut 3- minutes later, bu they never refilled our water glasses, despite several requests.   Add the lousy service to the fact that a mandatory 20% tip is built in (no mention of that is made on the website or when you make a reservation), two stars is just about what the place warrants.  Oh, and we were a party of four - a small group that didn't warrant a mandatory charge in my book.

7rAjfK9cJ0sOsvu1Pg_0yA.review_text: Sunday Drag Brunch...Food is average, service was decent and the show was tired! Sorry guys but you are lucky to be getting the three stars. Great concept and amazing venue however the show's lady of the evening phoned it in! Be fresh, be relevant and give the appearance that you enjoy what you do!

6HfGx_gVu1IHFnPL66kAOQ.review_text: I've been hearing about the Starlight Room since I was two and a half feet tall. That didn't set me up with any unrealistic expectations, surprisingly.  My only expectations were of the view. I mean that's all I ever heard about it, coupled with silly stories told behind grandiosity. Funny how the stories didn't stick, but rumors of the view did. The view came through. I took a million and one pictures that I will keep under my pillow.   Moving my eyes from the beautiful outside to the beautiful inside, I spotted divine household accoutrements that would fair well within my humble abode - mostly sofas and chairs. I didn't take any home with me, but there's always next time.   As superficial as I tend to be with regard to aesthetic design, the mishmash deejaying and interesting array of people didn't phase me. Although, an interesting array of folk is something I do quite enjoy, mishmash musical adventures are not. I heard music from every genre that night. Maybe we can attribute this to it being a weeknight.  Mr. Denton, I plan to return to your room sometime in the near future.

2R8Fh3tdzfIx8jRQuRF6kw.review_text: Really love this place. We parked around the corner at 450 Sutter which is a 24 hr parking facility. Its tough to park around the hotel on the street, and Union Sqare garage is hit or miss, so try the Sutter garage.   We arrived to the Starlight Room about 8pm this past Saturday and stayed until 12:30. We got in before 8:30, so there was no cover charge. We were lucky enough to get a window table. I love the lounge itself with the sexy old school vibe, lots of  deep red texture carpets, high back 50's club style table settings, the shimmering gold bead curtain details, and romance in the air with the stunning views of the city through the walls of glass windows.   The music was very relaxing, slow grooves and classics perfect for the mood and atmosphere of the dining and cocktail experience. Our first server was Kendra. She is very elegant, and beautiful, and really took care of us for the first couple of hours. Every member of the staff the first shift of the evening were spectacular. We got to watch the sunset, and enjoy small plates by candle light. We tried the deep fried mac and cheese, the crab cakes, the chicken nuggets and the shrimp cocktail. I ordered mojitos and the husband ordered chocolate martinis. The food runner and the busboy were both wonderful, although I didnt get their names. Each of the small bites were delicious and great cocktail bites.   We were there to celebrate post nuptials with friends of ours. They arrived about 930, so we closed out our dinner tab to the tune of about $150 including tip. Kendra and staff of the first shift made that worth every penny.  We secured keeping our same table for the dancing part of the evening by handing over our credit card for the tab and were passed along to the second shift, which I will call the dj shift.   Alessandra was our server for the second shift.  Although the uniform is the same, the service level did come down a notch. There were no smiles, and the elegant service converted to a cocktail service. We did not feel the same treatment, but more the standard 'are we ok here?' Type of attitude. We were with a bride and groom and it would have been nice to have some sort of acknowledgment of that, with a smile and a personalized feel, but I digress. For the prices we are paying, we just expect more. I can go to a bar and be served anywhere, but the. Starlight is classy and patrons want that...   There were two Dj's I think. The vibe changed from romance to party time. The crowd was an interesting mix of 30 somethings to 50 somethings. The music was 90s to top 40, and Im not a big dancer by any means, but they got me out on the floor a LOT! We ordered two cocktails each, average of 12 bucks or so each. Our bride and groom sat at an adjacent table with a couple of their friends. I am not sure what they ordered.   As mentioned, The second shift server was not at all nearly as attentive. My husband even had to go to the bar to get a drink for the bride and groom as we waited quite some time for her to serve us... After a lot of fun dancing had by all we were ready to head out. Around midnight or so we asked to close our tab. Alessandra asked if we wanted to combine our tab with our friends table. Um, no, we have separate tabs as secured by our card. No smiles, no thank you, just heres your tab and see ya type of attitude. A TOTAL turn off considering we dropped 200 dollars here tonight! What a disappointment!   The brides shawl, which had been in the back of her chair the entire evening went missing. While the wonderful manager and door staff sought to find it for her, Alessandra seemingly hounded the bride and groom, by going back over to their table grabbing the tab and putting it in the grooms hands to get them to settle it. Um, how rude! They arent going anywhere darling, they are working to try and find her cover up since she IS in a wedding dress and it would be nice to take home the accompanying cover up for her dress on her wedding night. Just sayin!  All in all the experience, minus Alessandra, was wonderful. She loses a star for you. We will definitely be back, we just will request not to be seated in her section.

GT4TT5MOuvCC_9Dde1qGkA.review_text: On top of the world at the Francis Drake Hotel in SF. This place has a great view of San Francisco. Great Atmosphere, good good, what more can you ask for?

j-1qkha4h87wMfNfwPvfqQ.review_text: This Lounge is located on the top of this historical hotel (Sir Francis Drake), it's very classic with some modern touches. Sometimes you feel like your lounging in the 1920's and 1930's and maybe you would run into a Don Draper lookalike. lol  I'm use to go going to the bars and lounges in Las Vegas so I'm use to chic and trendy. This would be nothing but a yawn to me but the 180 view of the city was breathtaking.  They have 3 different areas in the lounge:  1. Bar area: It's a bit small and it gets packed during the weekends because of the live bands and DJ. Bartenders are friendly but they have a limited selection, I tried to order an AMF but they were short on 2 liquors. Boo!! So I ended up order a Jack and Coke and sorry to say that was watered down! I can taste more coke then Jack, I ordered 2 more Jack and coke and sprite and I still felt no buzz. I was pissed but I didn't want to complain, so I just stuck with beer. I asked the bartender what kind of beer they have and he said, Coors Light, Budlight and Heinkein.   Really? Just three different kinds of beers.   Psssh!!  **WARNING** DON'T PAY WITH YOUR CREDIT CARD OR YOU'LL BE CHARGED $50, EVEN IF YOU BOUGHT ONE OR TWO DRINKS AND PAID LESS THEN $20. YOU'LL STILL BE CHARGED $50!! TOTAL BS!!  PAY CASH OR PREGAME BECAUSE THE DRINKS ARE WATERED DOWN!!   2. Dance Floor: The size of the floor was meh and the DJ was lame playing music from 70's, 80's, 90's and some top hits. I was hoping he'd play some house or trance music but you can always get everything. Lots of tourist and Francisco locals here at the Denton Lounge.   3. Table Area: One side of the lounge has an area to sit down and just relax with friends, spouse, bf, gf and etc...   Great to have a conversation while having some fine wine or beer and admiring the Downtown Skyline, Union Square, Bay Bridge and from a distance you can see SFO.  I wouldn't mind coming back for the lounge and looking at the city view. The cover can be expensive at $10 for what you get here but hotels guests get in free if you show your room key.

SyqlLW1fw33Wa2MZsInZqg.review_text: The Sunday's a Drag Brunch is great fun!!!  Be sure to have reservations and bring your wallet because drinks are not free.  The brunch is good enough but the show is what makes it.  Great place to take your mom (I did) as it is during the day and a welcoming show.  We were a group of twelve, but be forewarned - they do not do separate checks so have everyone in your party bring cash if you are splitting checks.

lQlBREgObRMuu-ghO0u4NA.review_text: Too formal to have such rude staff!  They made us feel so unwelcome that we just ordered a small plate and left immediately.

50KDUCtdS31stl9EvVWc6g.review_text: I love this place. Breathtaking view, nice music on Wednesday nights, friendly staff. We were on the guestlist, so it was free for me and $5 for the guy. The front door people were really friendly, we got there really early so the place was still pretty empty. The bartenders were extremely friendly and fast.  Really love the Wednesday night music, nice hip-hop, r&b, top 40. I danced like there was no tomorrow:-)  I think that this along with the Cellar on Sutter will remain my two fav spots in the city.

ojQ-3kJYJkwNbV56r1DDQA.review_text: A really cool place. It's classy, and a great place for drinks. They make an apple martini that uses real apple juice, a must try.  Good service and one of the best views of the City from up there. It's on the roof of the Sir Frances Drake hotel.  If in the are you should go up for a drink. View of the city (5) and drinks a 4.  Cver all a 3.5.

lnDP_h7cGYS3yzjkoCbtwA.review_text: I think their overall 3-star rating is very spot-on. It's nice...but leaves a bit to be desired. I think it's just a little too 80s glam looking right now and needs a little face lift. The views though...amazing! So pretty! Service was swell, drinks were great, great venue for a reception but didn't blow me away.

EO47ao8qAykoK1PGstY4JQ.review_text: Visited because if your from SF you have to go at least once. Glad I did but can't see myself going back until I am at least 40 since it's for the more mature crowd. I still enjoyed myself and the view was just as lovely as the pictures portray. I suggest going back for NYE based on the reviews it seemed like the place to be to ring in the new year.

nGozHYFspeWe2DliD9GqcA.review_text: I'll have you know: I AM ONLY A FAN OF THE VIEW.  THE END.  $10 cover. Should be paying ME to come here, shoot. Drinks were expensive. Overcrowded through and through (I was basically dancing with the window). Intensely small dance floor. Bartenders were J-Shore (read: doucheholes). DJ was good but mean (Nate Dogg passed the day before; I requested a song by him and he gruffly replied, "I ALREADY played one by him"... WELL SORRRRRY! Sheesh). Lots of creepsters (aka old men). Too many dancing hoes. (See above for why I felt bad for them)  But PRETTY VIEW!

l26TgP9ox03XRLDuG-9wvA.review_text: Came here months ago to celebrate my friend's 27th birthday with the "Sunday's a Drag."   You should know, right off the bat, you're paying for the experience- not the food! The buffett, while extensive, isn't anything that makes you crave more. There's a nice spread- but it's a buffet after all. (I did think the custom-order omelette bar was pretty cool though!)  That being said, the show was absolutely entertaining. Those gals can certainly entertain! I wasn't entirely sure what to expect, but the lip-syncing costume wearing men in drag certainly kept us laughing and singing along.   I had a good time, and we all enjoyed ourselves. It's a true SF experience.

FxcmX5skqHyqmxkubdn9gg.review_text: The starlight room: offering SF's saddest bottle service.   These guys try too hard to be something they're not. As with many other union square places, locals can safely pass.

jvPKzJ5bqA6QzB3p9PPzPQ.review_text: I've never eaten here, I can only speak for everything else. Coat check is always really polite. A long wait for drinks sometimes but it comes with the territory and the drinks are fine. We mostly come here for the dancing and the view- both are amazing!! Makes for a very romantic date night spot for couples who don't get out a whole lot. You get to people watch and dance and see some liveliness without having to stomach a nightclub. And did I mention the view is amazing?? Nothing bad to say about this spot.

iK4QagEgn0q30ys4bhBb1A.review_text: Attention:  Only rating the Sunday's a Drag show.    Really good show.  Went for mother's day Drag Brunch show because mom is on the East Coast and what the hell.  It was a great show.  Wish the show was longer which means it was good.  We lucked out an had a table next to the stage.  Get there early and see what you can do.  Good to be close.  The Sister of Perpetual Indulgence were in the front row so it was like two shows in one.    Food was not the focus.  Don't expect much more than average brunch.  Your paying for the show.

3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w.review_text: Awesome Parties with Coworkers & Friends in a Truly Eclectic Space!  SITREP  I usually don't find myself partying in Union Square to be honest.  That usually happens in SOMA or the HAIGHT.  However, when work events (Conventions: GAG) or even holiday soirees in downtown San Francisco end early, it's often fun to be able to just traipse through the Union Square Hood and head to the Starlight Room (even better if there was an early evening of Ice Skating mixed into an early night, and now it's refreshment time!)  SETUP  The Starlight Room is located on the 21st Floor of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel, and it is a TOTAL TRIP back in time to a more swanky, quasi-speakeasy feel.  I love it.  The music is usually cranking a wonderful mix of oldies, disco and some retro, along with the mainstay of pop and R&B.  [Note:  if you are looking for a rave, house or really young clientele, this is NOT your place.]  WORK CREW  There is something here that a very diverse group of coworkers will enjoy here:  music, plush surroundings, comfortable seats, private alcoves, sparkly dance floor, astounding drinks, pleasant eye candy of all ages, genders, and denominations. ;)  HOURS  Unless you are part of a private event, you are pretty much out of luck getting in on a Monday Night.  [sometimes I wish I could since I would like to start here in the early evening, and then I just end up at DNA Lounge for Death Guild which goes late.]  But this is why it's important to check the calendar ahead of time so you won't be disappointed.    SPECIAL EVENTS  They have a very cool Drag Brunch on Sundays, and most nights you can enjoy the mixing stylings of DJ Dave Gillis.  So it's hard to go wrong if you are looking for something that everyone will find a piece of that they really like at different times of the week.    THE LOWDOWN  I really do love the Starlight Room, brought to you by Harry Denton.  :D

VcTfxNgtcbSVrBO_A0EhBA.review_text: I was just there this Sat (Aug 1st) and it was definitely not a place I would like to return in the future.  I went to the Starlight Room, because of a friend's b-day party. I love the friend's crowd and the view. (The view is amazing... for the view only I would give five starts, but...) However, everything else was just not for me.  First, the dance floor is very small.  Second, the average age of the dance floor was 50+.... I am a dancer and it is nearly impossible for me not to dance, but this night, I didn't even move my feet...   Third, I hated the crowd... for me there was no class and was not for young people. I have no problem going to older crowd, but this crowd really gave me uncomfortable atmosphere. I saw few couples making out when some people were still dining.  It was just NO NO NO for me.  The view was great, but it was pretty much it.  (I checked yelp before going to this place, and low ratings I saw pretty much said the right things.)

f2kprM12LzRr9KcP_X-87Q.review_text: Okay, so, context: a friend and I were *purposely* looking for an absurd experience and were tipped off that there's a decent house show called "dresscode" here some thursday nights. Why not, eh?  I pass this place twice a day walking to and from work and have always assumed it to filled with Barry Manilow lookalikes and purple leisure suits, but it was quite hip the other night. Chartreuse and PBR combo for five bucks, plus several great house sets. It was a pleasure to finally experience the Denton.

51f-gzLdOCAeSNyhdXJX6Q.review_text: Stopped by here on a Tuesday night with some coworkers. The place was practically empty, which is apparently not usually the case. Our waitress was very friendly and made some drink recommendations to my coworkers based on the type of liquor they wanted, (rum and whiskey). I ordered a glass of wine.   I tried both of their drinks, a Cable Car, and a ginger whiskey drink, I didn't catch the name of that one. The Cable Car was fantastic. The rim of the glass was coated in cinnamon and sugar.   For a snack I ordered the Mac and Cheese crisps. Which were fried Mac and cheese squares with bacon. They were pretty good, I just wish they had been a little hotter.   The view at this place is absolutely amazing. I definitely plan on calming back to check it out on a weekend night.

Tdsd6ojiId3tgJsBBQz4NA.review_text: What a scene!  Every time I turned my head, I had a new, weird site to see.  There was the wannabe Milli Vanilli/Rick James dude rocking the keyboard for the live band.  Then there's the too old to be going out on a Saturday night couple grinding and sucking face on the dance floor.  Sitting down, we have the middle-aged Russian men with the peroxide blonde hookers trying to earn a quick buck.  Aside from all the interesting "scenery," I have had fun dancing here, as they have a pretty good mix of music.  And the drinks are pretty tasty as well.  The set-up is what I would imagine and old school Brat pack type lounge would be like.  So, come to this place ready for some entertainment.  It's the perfect mix of cheesy and classy.

tIRh_AmxJhUgzoHUBMPnlA.review_text: So after Cityscape, we checked out the Starlight Room (Sir Francis Drake Hotel). The view is  ok (26th floor) compared to Cityscape (46th floor).  There's a cover charge of $15 (by the I'm not a fond of) but whatever, it's my first time. Saturday night was packed, that included a bridal party. For the first time, we felt we were the youngest patrons in the crowd.  There was a live music but unless you are drunk then you won't care. In short it wasn't that great but they did a good job in hyping up the patrons.  We decided to just hang out at the bar. Cocktail prices were pricey, beer and Chambord sour for $20 something. The bartenders were friendly but my Chambord sour tasted like cough syrup, yuck. They do not have hypnotiq or the mix for my hurricane, boo!  Oh well, regardless we made the most of our cover charge. Hhmmm, I might check this place out on Wed night, I heard it's poppin. (dj = hiphop)

Gv_BjUXgTVUzoP2SDcDyQQ.review_text: The Harry Dean Stanton Starlight Room has always been a good-ol time for drinking, dancing, and humanity-watching.    The view from the front, back, and even restroom windows is incredible, and not just your ability to peer into rooms on many floors of the adjacent Marriott, but your vista of much of SF.    The diversity of ethnicities present, as well as age groups, makes the place all that more interesting. Seems to be about 50:50 tourists:locals, with "locals" being anyone who drove or took BART there for the night, as opposed to flying in from somewhere.    Dance floor features everyone from 21 to 80 having a good time.  Stiff drinks, friendly staff... yeah, it all clinches the deal.

UU1snpEq_rpTOlbuSHA5yg.review_text: A strange sort of bar. It's a crowded mix of semi-trendy people on internet dates and country rubes who are visiting SF and staying at the hotel. The views are good, but actually not that great given high up it is. The mediocre band (I don't mean that as insult; they weren't bad, they just weren't great) was really loud. There were some interesting old-fashioned drinks on the menu that I hadn't heard of before, unfortunately it turns out they aren't popular anymore because they aren't very tasty. The bartenders were working hard and giving good service given the menu they have to work with.

9L-NG0xL4Y5W5y4dnclyRw.review_text: Great venue for society cabaret shows. We saw the 1pm "evening with Molly Ringwald" show and it was the perfect intimate setting for classic jazz. Comfortable tables, great service and cocktails. A bit pricey menu, but expected for such a posh setting. The French 75 was a good choice to celebrate Bastille day. Molly and her jazz trio were great. She stayed and signed CDs after show and the pianist & drummer also chatted and signed my CD. The society cabaret founder was a gracious host and did a nice intro to Molly, his childhood friend.

Debq13UAOuxVmPiau3E1yQ.review_text: Went here during an event and it was super fun. It was packed and everyone looked like they were having a great time. The dance floor rocks and the music was great. The hotel itself is so amazing and has beautiful architecture and a great design. The best part by far is the view. The view is amazing! You can see everywhere and from multiple places. I was mesmerized. I will make a point of stopping by here again to check out the views

wjYtZFVzs2sIfwbUYb9EIA.review_text: My friend and I went for the first time the other day.  We mainly wanted to see the view and have drinks - so this review doesn't include food.  On first impression, the place looks fancy, but after you settle in and begin to look around, you actually see that the place is old and needs refreshing.  There's a delicate balance of elegance and tacky-drag queen-cheapness about the decor.  The place is more or less clean, but I did notice dust on the vents on the ceiling.  We ordered drinks from the bar and the staff were courteous and professional.  I bought a glass of champagne and paid with my credit card and noticed they do a $50 authorization every time the card is swiped.  Keep that in mind because if you order 3 drinks, your account will temporarily have a debit of $150 until the actual fee of say... $30.. posts to your account on the following business day.  That's a big deal if you have checks coming through or are on a budget.  Anyhow, it feels like the place is more of a tourist trap than anything.  The venue doesn't really command the price of the drinks.  It's nice to go there for the view and have a drink or two, but that's about all it's worth.

JQGGHtzTA10plLAPIXM5jQ.review_text: The Starlight Room is a San Francisco classic! Do not miss sunset, or Sunday's a Drag- brunch and show. Kenny makes the best martini in SF.

BhkkJQbSy_womFDYIYTgQg.review_text: Beautiful venue, unfortunately the bouncers are complete dicks.   Come here if you reallllly want a breath-taking view of the city. But if you want some customer service, do NOT go here. Also, the drinks are expensive and really watered-down.   AND - the crowd is really old.   It's really a shame since the venue is soo nice.

_GZ1-FQTWCfH7WQFo9rxwg.review_text: I have a confession to make. This was my first "Drag Brunch". No, it does not involve cars (which I thought that was a possibility, but then I realized it was in SF). So, this place is at the top of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel with some pretty good views (assuming that it isn't foggy/rainy in which it was with this case). First off the food was pretty good. Nice spread, omelet station with the obligatory prime rib. Fresh squeezed OJ, and mimosas!   As for the show, I have never had soo much fun at a brunch! No really, I thought it was pretty entertaining. It was pretty much G-rated so nothing really nasty. My phone sucked at taking pictures, so once my friend emails me the pics I will post them. So yes, I would say its worth the $45/person. Now when I go to Las Vegas, I just might consider something else than Cirque Du Soleil.   It is recommended that you make reservations but don't be late because they might make fun of you.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: I was excited to come back to the Starlight room after years of not being there. I remember good ol college days we used to hit up the starlight to dance our booties off with the tranny hookers, it was hillarious watching the lame guys falling for them. The place is newly remodeled and it looked nice, best part is of course the view! I was kinda bummed tonight, I was hoping on trying something there but all we got our hands on was alcohol. The pisco drink that tasted like apple pie was yummy and the pineapple tasting one was good too. I was nice and tipsy leaving. It was kind of disapointing they didn't plan very well with the food. The crowd wasn't that huge compared to other yelp parties and they just didn't serve enough. People were literally hovering and running toward the kitchen grabbing food as soon as it left the kitchen. I saw some balls that I overheard someone say was chicken nuggets and I saw something served on spoons. Bummer! I was hoping on at least snatching a ball before walking out but no luck. 3 stars for the amazing view and my friends enjoyed the whiskey tasting.

UVO0vrdc8Jfm00p7ixuf7A.review_text: Halloween 2014 party was wayyyyyyyy too packed and hot and steamy and the windows were fogged up.  o noooooooo.  wait half hour to get in line to get on elevator to get up. o mannnnnnn  The place truly does look nice. Red. Velvet. ETC. I'd be down to come back in daytime to eat or check out view.  Needs a 2nd chance.

DTEa4cIRdr6T4jaIw1xubg.review_text: WOW!!!  I've been at this beautiful hotel before but I've never knew about this lovely little place on the 22nd floor even existed! My friends and I came on a Wednesday night, I didn't really think people partied on a Wednesday but apparently they do! I don't know if there was cover or how much it is because our group did bottle service but these bouncers/security men are all dressed as if they're Secret Service or something with their suits and ear pieces.   Anyways, as we were led to our booth, I was just in complete ''awe". The view was soo pretty! The dance floor wasn't big nor was it too small. It was so cool to be dancing the night away while the huge windows let you stare over the city. The crowd, however, has to be the most random and weirdest set I've ever seen--all in one place. But, hey...we are in San Francisco.   So, if you're ever in the area on a Wednesday, definitely check this place out!

5_WAT6jyEBKi1RQvKhRu_Q.review_text: One of my favorite places to go in the city, mid-week. Harry Denton allows Sebastian Entertainment to take over the venue on Wednesday nights to spin hip-hop tracks and old skool favs. The crowd is always such a great mix, it's hard to categorize it. A lot of European folks tend to hear about this place and check it out.  There's usually a line to get into the elevator to go upstairs to the lounge and cover is around $10 if you aren't on the guest list. Drinks are expensive but generously made. I've always had a great time here, dancing the night away. The deal maker is the amazing view you get of Union Square and the city. It's simply breathtaking!

FJUTbKkY10tNcn5_10Ethw.review_text: On the 21st floor of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel, it is hard for this place not to be cool and swanky.  The interior is very pretty and has huge windows that give you an amazing view of the city. This is definitely not your "ultra lounge" or club with thumping bass and lasers, but there is a nice dance floor.  On the night I was there, they alternated between a DJ playing pop/hip-hop and a live band doing mostly cover songs.    While my girlfriend and I did not take advantage of them, there is a large area of tables and private seating areas that would be great for a small group and give it more of that VIP feeling.    One of the craziest aspects of this place is the huge age range of the people there, all the way from 21, up to 50s and 60s.  This is not necessarily a bad thing and makes for a more interesting and diverse crowd.   While this is probably not a place I would want to go every week, I definitely feel like this is a great place for special occasions.  The Starlight Room is perfect for those nights where you want to go out, but you want it to be a little extra classy.

puS8HuNdeXhhl5F4bb0EEg.review_text: This is definitely a must go place in San Francisco.  It's on the 21st floor of the elegant Sir Francis Drake hotel.    The cover charge the night we went was only $10.  That was Saturday.  I had a cosmo and it was really good.  I like a lot!  The dance floor was packed and crowded, goes very well with my taste.  And they played music that can really get anybody to shake their booties :).  Very nice party place indeed.  And who wouldn't love the view.  I love the city of San Francisco at night.  And to see it from a lovely place, really sets the mood.  I heard they offer brunch and dinner here.  I am excited to come back and dine here.

mQUoN1QcGI3AEpu5su1PHg.review_text: This review is for the Sunday's a Drag Brunch only. First of all, I want to say that we like this room. It is old school and very San Francisco. The Sir Francis Drake is a charming old hotel and as far as we've ever known, it has had a good reputation. That is why we thought we would have a good experience at the brunch. As it turned out, we had such a bad experience that we couldn't believe it.  It was clear from the beginning the staff didn't have their act together. It started out with bad service and then the afternoon only went from bad to worse. It took forever and a day for the wait staff to take our drink order and then forever to get our drinks. BTW, a pitcher of Mimosas (a carafe, mind you) is priced at $60. Yes, you heard me...sixty dollars.  Cocktails are priced at $13. \Only New York has worse cocktail prices but that's the Big Apple for you. Anyway, the tables are small and barely big enough to eat on. Halfway into the brunch, there was little food left on the buffet tables. We could not believe it. While I will spare you the other gory details, I will tell you I would not recommend this brunch. That it is ridiculously over-priced at $60 a pop (not including cocktails and tip) has got to mean they cater to the tourists. That others have raved about it is surprising considering the unfortunate experience we had. Needless to say, we were extremely disappointed with what we thought would be a fun afternoon. What a shame. We actually were looking forward to this experience but it certainly didn't work out the way we thought it would.

MiQr7921e6ewplyyGkMPnA.review_text: Went up on a Sat night expecting someplace to have a cocktail, look at the view and listen to the band or dance.  It was worse than any bar I have ever been in.  Packed in the entire room, 5 deep at the bar and lots of cruising older men.  This could have been a good thing for me (not) but they were interested in my daughters - twenty years their junior.  We had a laugh, got to dance and then got the heck out of there.  I could not see the decor, there were no elegant creatures to wait on us.  All in all, a waste of a great view.

X3F4vGH3xcwX3bBO1qnmUQ.review_text: This place is definitely not for the young adults looking to experience anything hip. If you like to chum with 40 + year old people when you are in your 20s, looking to hang out at a cool trendy place with people about your age and NOT wanting to get down to KC and the Sunshine band, not a good place for you to go. If it weren't for being with my silly and fun sister, I would have been bored shitless because it was too old for me. I had to drink quite a bit to have a good time. After about 7 cocktails, I got my ass on the dance floor and hustled my heart out to the Bee Gees, but I won't be going back until I am closer to 40. By then, they'll be playing "Old school Justin Timberlake" tunes.   Basically, if you do decide that you must go just to see the panoramic view of San Francisco or if you are staying at the hotel, then expect the place to be shoulder to shoulder packed and lacking service due to all the hustle and bustle. The poor servers have to wear black formal gown in heals all night because that's there uniform, so that sets the tone. The MC is very retro and plays much R&B and Smooth Jazz for your listening pleasure..... The drinks are made very well. Yeah, that's about it. There are many other places to go to in San Francisco. Go here if you must.

W1t71ODI0GF256RA0Ba5ww.review_text: Only reason I am giving this a 2 is because it had a nice view. The waitstaff was horrible. Didn't ask us hardly how we were doing. Took too long to take orders and give us our drinks. BUMMER

MjCIBCRp7p4B_ITMWDpKzQ.review_text: I feel somewhat bad about giving this place 2 stars, as I always have an enjoyable time while I'm here. But here's why it only deserves 2 stars...  $10 cover charge to get in ($5 if you have a hotel key... yes, I borrowed some dude's hotel key to make my cover charge less). Somehow I've managed to get around the cover charge almost every time, or at least make it less than $10. I'd never pay $10 to get into this place. There are better bars and dance clubs in the area that are free to get into.  The decor in this place is DRAB. Completely old fashioned. The Starlight Room is grandparents house meets night club.  Pretty much everyone in this place is a tourist, but you get a few of those regular douchebags who "know the owner" so they're there every night. There are a lot of older people in this place. I don't really want to be intentionally  rubbed up against by a 50 year old creeper on the way-too-small dance floor. No thanks.  The music is okay. You get your standard top 40 here, the norm.  Bartenders are friendly. That's a plus.  The view is incredible. Pretty sure about 90% of the people that live in SF that actually come to this spot is ONLY for the view, and nothing more. However, there are way too many other local places with a view to ever have an excuse to come here.  So why have I been here on multiple occasions? Because I'm with a group of friends, I'm not completely sober, and someone comes up with the brilliant idea that we should all go to the Starlight Room.  When I sober up, I realize I don't like it-- each, and every.single.time. However, come with a group of friends, and you're going to have fun anyways.

7igYjtQ2kI166vtqCBRnhA.review_text: $15 cover charge on a Saturday night. Only 1 bar w/ a few bartenders. Small dance floor where 1/3 is taken up w/ the sound booth.
