Overpriced drinks but my gin/soda was made well. Live band which played fun, old-timey dancing music, but when they went on break hip-hop & R&B was piped in. "Older" crowd (no offense, just stating the facts of the evening - we'll all be there one day!) so mingling was kept to a minimum that evening for us. Glad I went post-renovation to see the "new" Starlight room but that curiosity is satisfied & I don't expect to return.

TSdV_lsddT4F3TJvmdmXag.review_text: A little piece of old-school San Francisco, smack dab on top of the Sir Francis Drake hotel.  Everything is red, red, red, from the curtains to plush booths to the hibiscus martini.   I hadn't been to the Starlight Room before they redid their cocktail menu: now it's organized by era, and there are at least 50 concoctions to try.  At $10-12 per drink, it's not cheap, but there are a few gems there.    The bartenders are talented and friendly, and the view is spectacular.  It's not quite on par with Alembic, Local Edition, Rickhouse, and Smuggler's Cove for fancy cocktails, but if you're a San Franciscan, you have to come here at least once to soak up the ambiance.  Go early to avoid a cover charge!

a7_jTn-XrObX8pDq6mzBnw.review_text: Loved it....Have gone to 2 events at this place; the service is amazing, our waitress was the best

OpEsYCdTioMDUFib7d-YuA.review_text: When I read people griping on Yelp about how this place is packed with old folks, I knew it would be right up my alley-- The elderly, more often than not, have got it right!   I came here for the first time two years ago on my birthday for weekend night dance-party table service and we very much enjoyed the views-- both of the ice rink below and city beyond, as well as the indoor views of older, gold-chain-wearing, off-duty-limo-driver-looking dudes trying to get their swerve on with their "working-girl" dates.  We returned for my birthday this year on a Monday, so no cover and the bar was nearly empty.  The views were just as stellar, the space just as charming, the bartender was entertaining and open to experimentation (I was with a couple of cocktail snobs)...  We had just come from a completely unsavory experience at Top of the Mark. Never again will I cheat on Harry when I want my old-school SF special-occasion fix.

TmhFYYTHodJnrubq9IeFNA.review_text: Great view of Union Square. No cover if you make it before 9pm like we did. Our drinks were strong and pricey ($12). But we just wanted to check out the view so just had 1 cocktail each. It was empty when we got there so was able to walk around and see nice view, esp by dance floor. It gets 3 stars because there were a lot of old people and the music was for old people, played by an old woman. Nothing against any of that .. just so you know. Good for a quick stop.

NWh_jjR3MTsYeKzSvVrKZw.review_text: This was at the top of our hotel, I was hoping it'd be a nice place to hang out. The cover charge was ridiculous considering we were already in the hotel for the weekend. It would have been nice to have no cover charge if we could prove our room reservation.  We walked over to the bar and my 4 friends and I ordered drinks, I ordered water due to already drinking before coming and the bar tender seemed insulted. We watched as the bartender measured every single part of the drinks and didn't even fill the jigger with alcohol or juice when measuring then were over charged for said drinks (feels like over charged due to no alcohol content and the glasses filled MAYBE 1/2 way as well. )  We tried to sit down, and there were only dirty tables everywhere, underneath/on the floor of ours was someone's jacket in which we thought someone had left behind. After 20 minutes of sitting/chatting/drinking someone came over and claimed it was their table and kicked us out (despite the jacket there was no indication someone was there or occupying, the drinks were empty and dirty plates) as we tried to walk elsewhere a host finally seated us at "reserved" booths and the music was so loud you had to YELL over everything to basically talk to someone sitting next to you.  After maybe 30-40 minutes in total we walked out.

sXhGLvb7dIYBrzDh4s5UnA.review_text: We came here to celebrate a friend's birthday during their "Sunday's a Drag" brunch. The brunch ain't all-that and their drinks are crappy (and not included with the price of admission), but the show is something you must experience once. The host, Donna Sachet, is darn funny!

e2YinjKYN_hR2Ol74ksnYg.review_text: Worst business practices and horrible event planners!!!   The staff stole my personal property!!!

tvZKPah2u9G9dFBg5GT0eg.review_text: A bunch of us crazy girls celebrated a birthday at the Sunday's a Drag this morning.  I can call my friends crazy.... they're all crazy for being friends with such a train wreck.... ME.  Upon entering the Sir Francis drake, my breathe was taken away.  Not just from the stairs, not from the hike in high heels from the parking garage... it is a beautiful hotel.    The whole point of going to the show is not just the food, but the service and mostly the entertainment.  I was amused throughout the entire show.  Those queens are fucking gorgeous.  I fucking heart them.  Here is a list of what I consumed this morning in the Starlight Room: bacon (fuck it was good) bacon (I couldn't get enough of that shit) eggs benedict (I almost broke a tooth on the muffin) macaroon (fucking delicious) bacon (yeah, again) spinach salad (needed a bit of balance) 2 cups of hot tea (the vanilla bean with 1/2 a packet of sweetener) 1 slice french toast (it didn't need syrup... it was too sweet)  The performances were fun.... I laughed so much, I think I may have peed a bit.... TMI?  Too bad, the show was worth it!

Tu8KzhQPTORweWWaH8PQGg.review_text: Weird experience but overall a good one. Met up with some friends here while visiting San Francisco on a Saturday night. The crowd was ollder but the music was young. Me and my friends danced and had fun, also got great views of Union Square from the dancefloor. However, it took forever to get a waitress or a drink and like the other posts I had to check my card because initially they overcharged me about $25. I checked a couple days later and it was corrected. Also, was not pleased they said the door charge was $5 and when we got upstairs they raised it to $10, they were only giving free admission before 9 and to hotel guests.

CpH7oGBpmUU4LUK0OOotMA.review_text: Oh yea here is an update.   Me gets screwed. Eff the details!!!

NIhcRW6DWvk1JQhDhXwgOQ.review_text: Harry Denton's Starlight Room is at the top of the Sir Francis Drake hotel.  While not completely panoramic views, it does have a great view, a fun DJ, and a disco ball.  The space is lounge-y, with a dance floor next to the windows.  After 10, a younger crowd came in for dancing.  I just went for drinks, and I loved my Savoy Bounce, while expectedly pricey, was strong.  Service was great - the man who escorts you to the table is hilarious.

KG5YQRCDZHRhBq-Jfkq87w.review_text: Located at the top of Sir Francis Drake hotel.  We wanted to have a different experience and yes, we got one.  The host was very personable.  He sat us within a few minutes (I got the seating karma this night) and event got a window seat.  Wow.  Dancing with the view of SF is really cool.  We can even see the lighted Christmas Tree on Union Square.  Music was upbeat.  Really really enjoyable place.  Its a must try if you are in SF bay.

OI4_xMb9JqcIWP46nucqLA.review_text: This is in the 21st floor of the Sir Frances Drake Hotel.   It's ok.  Go there for the view, not the menu, and not the sky-high priced drinks.  This menu is awful--it had waffles, and it had even chicken nuggets.  Weird and out of context with a table cloth and candle lit environment--and waitresses with long Oscar night gowns.  Mixed bag.  Food awful, no choices for someone wantng food or appetizers.  Drinks were outrageous.  We enjoyed the sunset and city lights, not the ambience of the restaurant, and NOT any of the food.  There is so much this place can do to make itself better.  I just don't get it.  I would go for the view again, WITH fine company, but never go again for any other reason.  This hotel blows it with this restaurant.  I'm surprised people ever come back.. The service was very good.  Also, unlike the bathroom shortage in the rest of this hotel, this floor for the tiny restaurant-bar had a big bathroom with mutliple stalls!  that was a rarity believe me.  This whole place is central, but it doesn't have much going for it otherwise, for the money.

_V6qMBCSzhwx96FLB3CJRw.review_text: I have seen "The Birdcage" approximately 8,000,000 times.  Granted, my favorite part of that movie is any scene that Hank Azaria is in, but I also love to see the interaction between Robin Williams and Nathan Lane, as well as Gene Hackman dressed up as a woman.  My mother also loves that movie, for many of the same reasons.  So it was fitting that for her birthday, we come here for brunch.  My mother is somewhat of a fruit fly/fag hag.  The apple doesn't fall from the tree.  For the most part, it was good.  Nothing stellar in terms of the eats, but definitely tasty and worth it.  Drinks are a little pricey, but that's to be expected.   I got the deal through a Groupon (or something like that), so it took a bite out of the cost.    Not the best drag show I've seen, but it's certainly fun.  The headliner was some redhead who did Reba, and s/he was spectacular.  i could have lived without seeing a Lady Gaga impersonation, because I'm still not convinced that the "lady" isn't tucking.  It's a worthwhile thing for guests in town, although I did feel sorry for the dude who got dragged in by his girlfriend.  Not the best place for a hot, straight, unmarried man.    But what place is, really?

wOS4w1V72x3NV6a-0Sz3iQ.review_text: The venue was really nice and the drinks were good. The bartenders and waiters are also really nice and welcoming, but I don't recommend it for people who are about 20-30, because even though the music itself was okay, a lot of the people that were there were kinda old. Definitely not for the younger crowd. And they didn't start playing the good music until after my friends and I left. In the beginning the music was old school like 90s and 80s and some early 2000s. Then they started playing hip hop and house music. But really there were hardly any people around my age and I'm 21.

CIT2QNZ_i4DGjTVz_SUieg.review_text: This place felt so cheesy. We went up to check it out and can't believe there is even a cover. Small dance floor, impressive view, a couple cool twosome tables by the windows, crappy music, go go dancers off to the side.  Been there, done that... Wouldn't go back.

EjAZFc4IeRGAxpTp_9WnBg.review_text: Madly in love with this wildly romantic, misty dreamy cloud-top paradise. I ascended into its heaven one twinkling evening on a tip from a local for a quick bucket of scotch. I don't know that Raymond Chandler ever wrote about the place, but he easily might have. The place impressed me as indelibly as my first kiss. Bedazzling. It still gives me goosebumps.

ZW--96fxunFhCkAL1AD83g.review_text: This place was fantastical! We took my cousin out for her birthday and had a wonderful time. Even though we were an hour late for our reservation, the host was still able to find us a table and seat us. The night we went there was a live band playing oldies and a DJ playing the radio hits. There was plenty of fun to be had by all!! ha ha so much fun in fact we helped ourselves to a few of the roses in the Starlight Room and security came over and told us the Flowers were for Decoration NOT Dancing! Hilarious!! Had we not watched a geriatric crew get arrested for fighting with security AND the police, we probably would have tested him for those Roses. Ha ha!  The View here is amazing, and it really made me miss my City! The night we were there it wasn't foggy so you could see all of Union Square. I gotta get back to SF and out of Miami!

-JQWn7dNVHLwrbrk8f-mzA.review_text: I went here Sunday night (4th of July) for their holiday party.  My friend had a comped bottle of vodka for her birthday so we sat down and were immediately waited on and before I knew it I had an ice-cold Vodka Soda in my hand.  Despite the fog, the views were great.  The decor was very subtle and relaxing with comfy booths and couches.  Small sized dance floor and the place was not packed (which was great).  I heard it gets really packed for their mid-week parties on Wednesdays; but I work during the week, so I won't be heading there on a Wednesday anyways.  The servers were all dressed in elegant dresses and the bouncers had tuxedo's on.  They definitely fit the vibe of the place.  Overall it was a fun night.  The DJ was good too - I'd definitely recommend this spot to a friend looking for a more relaxing lounge with good music.  P.S.  I gave only 4 outta 5 stars b/c the bouncers let some guy in wearing 2 polo shirts with double popped collars (white and blue).  Patriotic yes, but we aren't in Jersey "bro" -- The Situation called, he wants his style back!!

dbOrbdJyIsJEsyDYFYKNQQ.review_text: Came here twice during my stay and the first night was rocking with a great fundraising party and a great DJ. Unfortunately you could not see out of the windows since they were all sweaty.   The second night was great for happy hour and sunset with a more relaxed experience with a great view and a great chocolate mousse dessert.

GzEWQRtzgNBpjQ1E830vRA.review_text: Very nice place, good food and drinks. The music was great as well. But one of the security guards, a tall black guy with a goatee named Jared, was a real jerk. He was incredibly rude twice while we were leaving. It seemed like once the lights came on all he was interested in was being rude and shoving us out the door.

YwU0DqVz0L0gJ-Etg5l0Jg.review_text: I went there with my girl friends. It was one of girls' birthday. The waitresses there are dressed up in really elegant and beautiful long gowns. The service was extraordinary. The receptionist helped us manage two reserved tables. I really thank his kindness. The view in the dancing room is brautiful. Haha we went there at about 9. And the danving room slowly got crowded at about 10. They mixed up old and mainstream music. It is good place to hang out with friends. If you were tired, you could go to the dininv area to take a rest. Recommend!l

tBMdBlIFUoxWgpJ2NvdeBw.review_text: Came here for a night out with the ladies on Saturday and we loved it. The music was great, they played a mixture of 80's, 90's and today hits. The appetizer menu was not so great and serving sizes were very small, but besides that the music, view, and the whole atmosphere was fantastic. We will definitely be coming back!

KxRf-umHzdz5noKH5Cg6Mg.review_text: Great place for drinks and small bites with a view of the city. Of course, it all comes at a higher price but with the scenic view and fun music it's a great once in awhile splurge and great spot to hang with friends.   The food there is actually quite good. I tasted their fried Mac n cheese and their chocolate dessert and liked both. Portions are small so don't come with an appetite! As for the drinks I wasn't quite sure what to get so our waitress made a pretty good recommendation for me based on my likes. I forgot what it was but I enjoyed it :) FYI the menu on their website isn't always up to date and one time they did not have the ice cream on their menu that I wanted to try so you could be in for a bit of a disappointment.  The crowd is definitely older but the parties thrown by outside promoters bring in younger people so you'll get a good mixed crowd on those nights. It could get really packed and when it does good luck flagging down your waitress! We were ready to pay our bill and head out but she never came by. In the end we went to go find someone ourselves to take care of it for us.   The times I went both with and without a reservation, weekday and weekend, I lucked out and got a table by the window. I would recommend making a reservation just to be sure you get a table and one by the window for a nice view.   I haven't tried the brunch but it sounds like a fun thing to check out. Definitely in the evening Starlight is a nice spot to hang with friends and could be a romantic spot for couples as well!

im50cpAGJg_FMZUJofRYGw.review_text: Summary:  Eye candy  I have had a better time at the lobby bar of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel upon which this bar sits.  The evening we went, the cover was $15 which  I suppose pays for the view.  The decor and city view are this bars strongest points.  Our waitress (hostess or whatever the PC thing to call her) was very beautiful and elegant.  Drinks are of good quality but on the expensive side.  The overall feel of the staff, though, borders on pretension.  I may be more used to the amiability of smaller (i.e. less fancy) lounges.  The DJ played a good selection of music but his beat mixing needs a bit of work.  The security personnel are quite professional.

wmGUNwtFlQLxGrl3swVQ3g.review_text: I celebrated my 40th birthday party here and had a great time dancing. Very upscale place. Great ambiance and the service is wonderful. The only thing this place needs is a no poop policy on the "ladies" restroom door. It's a club not a gas station females really! I had to go 21 floors down to a non toxic bathroom.  Not the clubs fault in any way. But just thought I'd put it out there! Music was great and it was packed. It was St Patty's Day weekend. Robert is again, the hostess with the mostest. Even remembered us from last year's visit. Overall this place is highly recommended by me and my friends.  If you can get a VIP table..totally worth it. Thank you for hosting a fabulous evening stress free!

FuUQ7ph_trLKZLjuXWAFiA.review_text: My wife was grabbed on the behind a few times. I was standing right next to one of these sick bastards when he did it. When I grabbed him around his neck and politely told him that his actions were uncalled for he told on me to the staff. The crowd had all ages with a majority of old guys by themselves standing around watching young woman dance as if they were praying on them. I told all the women with our group to keep there drinks in hand and do not sit them down unattended. I Also told them not to take drinks from people as a gift because this place seemed like a place full of sick people praying on women trying to have fun by slipping something in their drinks. Hated it. Would never return. If you are into getting fondled and having sexual things happen to you without any care as to who is doing it, you may enjoy the place. I didn't enjoy how much I had to patrol the safety of the women that accompanied me here. I did it because I care for my friends but not the way to have a good time. Discussting and horrible place.

qRBTAUOEWrBY9N1JszH1ow.review_text: Go, go, and go!  How fun!  Went to their 12:00 brunch/drag show with performers Donna, Alexis, Cassandra and Lady Tia.  They were terrific!  The host (and performer), I think it was Donna, was witty, engaging and had great vocals.  The songs were eclectic, the costumes glittery and exciting, and the acts just superb!  Another awesome thing.  It's on the 21st floor of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel.  Beautiful view!  The food -  The brunch is buffet style and in the rear of the floor with a sweet site of the city.  Don't miss out on the french toast!  My friend asked and someone told her that creme brule was mixed into the batter.  (I thought it was crack!).  Anyways, it was DEE-licious!  So was the devil's egg, the chocolate covered strawberry and pretty much every other pastry layed out on the table.    Yes the 40 bucks is a little pricey for brunch (esp. when compared to places like St. Francis where you can fill your belly for less than $15), BUT you can eat AS MUCH as you want, the food IS delectable and the experience is just pure entertainment!

5tA6XMewAx5PWZHGSgwWbA.review_text: Review of "Sunday's a Drag":   I would give 4 stars, but added another star for just what it was, and how hard they try to please their clientele.  The cast is small, just 4 people, but since there are a lot of costume changes it seems like 20.  The MC and performer, Donna Sashay, was hilarious.  She quickly engaged the audience and had us laughing from the git go.  We were a bus load of folks from Petaluma, some 50 in all, and she made great sport of that pretending to have never heard of our town.  The show lasts about an hour, but was a lot of fun.  They are trying to establish the show as a San Francisco experience, and they depend a lot on word of mouth recommendations to advertise the show.  Review of the brunch.   The buffet, preceding the show, was first rate.  It was a full on brunch, including a omelet station featuring custom made to order omelets.  Plus prime rib cut to order. There was salads, desserts, and coffee.  Included was a cocktail of our choice, and my Bloody Mary was too strong but that was my fault for not choosing the mimosa or other choices.    Overall, the fixed price of $45 for everything.  It was a good value, including food, show, tax, tip, and alcohol.  The entertainers sat at the door after the show to chat with the crowd and pose for pictures.  Nice touch!

VUetlEs-Lcp3TYeCNzlfzQ.review_text: I've been to Sunday's a Drag at the Starlight Room several times now.  The food is great, the view is beautiful and the show is so much fun!  So many of us live in or near San Francisco and never do the "tourist thing."  I absolutely recommend this being one of those things you actually try.  The show is different each time.  Everyone raves about the bacon...and hey, it is good bacon, but ALL of the food is delicious!  Come, sample everything and enjoy being entertained for an hour!  (Call ahead, though, since the shows often sell out!)

v5GuMw3GumrWhL4_WlgNHQ.review_text: No maraschino cherries, no blue cheese stuffed olives. Can't make a Brooklyn cocktail...are you even a cocktail bar bro?

JuV8sk-evG7c1sQUK52agQ.review_text: Snobby staff!!!  great views, if you can look past the DIRTY DIRTY windows that have probably not been cleaned for years!  Staff is rude, and crowd is weird!  Skip this place and save your wallet a cover and expensive (weak) drinks!

D5aDhmN7Qthz16xczo40kg.review_text: As it turns out, the 50 dollar charge which I thought was the credit card limit is actually a pending charge that is reduced to the cost of the drinks you ordered after a few days. I do wish the staff informed customers of this instead of assuming we are aware of this "industry standard". However, I still recommend The Starlight Room for its atmosphere.

NnOJAzj8HnYWEqu9cV6_4w.review_text: Ok you gotta like 70s and cliche rollout stuff... but hey it was fun, tiny small dance floor but great great 8 piece band... all the old 70s stuff, Earth Wind Fire, Kool and Gang, TOP... it was great to go dance and have people there to just have fun, not cause trouble or be rude... we will go back particularly since we now like the Drake to stay for a weekend.. We're locals but playing in the City is kewl... Views were awesome!

vVEowpPzrXehovi0WUw64Q.review_text: Walked into this place with three other friends at around 12:00 a.m. on Saturday, March 8.  We went because I've been here before twice and it has always been hilarious (good people watching, fun music, etc). Bouncer asked for our IDs. As we were getting them out, we asked if there was a cover.  He looked over at the girl behind the desk, and asked "is there a cover?"  She looked at us, looked down at her book or whatever, then said yes, $20.  No smile from anyone, no nothing.  Wow - so this bouncer didn't know there was a cover, and the cover appears to be subjective.  I've been here before, twice, and the cover was $10.  Bottom line: shady business, and it's not that great to begin with to warrant $20.

d1sLYlfSzHo6WCpfe-j7zg.review_text: My friends and I came here a couple times.  I like that it has this amazing view of the city and always a live band playing.  It gets super crowded on the dance floor and everywhere for that matter...even if you get a table I always feel you need to fend for it and make sure no one takes it since everyone is eyeing for a seat.  Crowd here is pretty mix.  It makes it pretty entertaining to people watch with cougars on the hunt and playing the "is he/she in drag?" game.    I haven't gotten many drinks here we usually just get a big punch/sangria bowl to share which I think is pretty reasonably price most the time.  Service however can get hard with tons of people around.  you have to flag down your server sometimes to get a drink and get the bill.

gSDkhYBIAJIE5sKB_AVZyw.review_text: Great atmosphere and views of union square and the city. Good drinks and friendly staff. Very old fashioned feel to it which was cool. I would definitely come back.

4H4dQqBFkXh4AcsEdWYOIA.review_text: This place is located at the 21st floor of the hotel. It is $5 to get in. Drinks are good. Music is a little old school. The previous reviews were right about the people in the bar as being a little on the older side. Right around 10:30 there were go-go dancers that came and were dancing on top of the tables.

oqCWpZ4LpZS43ignuAj2EQ.review_text: We stopped by a rainy Sunday before Christmas.  Very classic old time bar. Bonus was meeting the stars of the Drag review!  Harry was at the bar and gave my newly-college-graduated son some great "real world" advice that I hope he takes to heart.  Great guy.  The Bloody Mary is probably one of the best I have ever had.  Classic, simple, great ingredients.  As Harry told me, it is all in the horseradish.  He is so right.  We can't wait to go back next year!

yv-P5qZrJx-EyfCfpkZORA.review_text: I'd give it 4 stars if the busser did not put our dirty flatware straight in front of us, on a clean white tablecloth, when taking our plates away. I don't mind reusing my dirty flatware but it should be put on a bread plate or a napkin. Not on a white clean tablecloth. It was disgusting. People in my party (party of 8) were raising brows when they saw this happen.  The show was fun overall. The "lady" performing the Tina Turner was amazing.

Z1dOk3GAdt1Wfn1I1KWMEw.review_text: Let's break this down:  -1 star for $15 cover charge in the weekend -1 star for super watered down drinks with warm glasses -1 star for security rudely yelling at us to leave when it's not even 2am  -1 star for the stuffy furniture and a limited bar  Basically, the remaining star is for the view. Would not willingly come again.

DMutsdi8ejYEyFAF8ZRDEA.review_text: Crowded late in the evening, but fun for dancing and curling up at a table. Some great drinks and an enjoyable place to be. Little bit of an older crowd and sometime hard to find a table, but an interesting place.

Xw0TuvGJTCsHK-4WHpN9jg.review_text: Brunch is a Drag on Sundays is a HOOT! Really great show, delicious food and well mixed cocktails. Best show in town.

K5UHLEadijlcXeT1NQ0V4g.review_text: Had an awesome bachelorette brunch here at the "Sundays are a Drag" brunch. We got a table right near the center of the room, and had a great time watching and interacting with the fabulous drag performers. It is a VERY interactive show :o) Host Donna Sashay is funny and charming, and the other performers were equally hilarious and engaging. My favorite was probably Cassandra Cass because she's pretty much Real Life Jessica Rabbit. Plus, her costumes were gorg.  The brunch part was super yummy too. Eggs benedict, prime rib carving station, chocolate covered strawberries, a variety of pastries, salads, and other breakfast items (bacon, canadian bacon, sausage, eggs, etc.). We also made sure to order plenty of mimosas as well. That really adds to the experience ;)  Got to take pics with the performers afterwards as well. LOVED IT!

RR6chkvedisFnKmo8eu65g.review_text: This is such a classy place with a great view of all of downtown. So beautiful and elegant. Even our cocktail servers wear long black flowy dresses. How nice...I went there on a weekend and had bottle service in one of the booths...I had so much fun and I had such a great time. Their view of the city is just magnificent and they also have a dance floor too. There is an admissions fee but I think it's all worth it.

niR5DH1r6JVQaEBnuyQHZw.review_text: Went for a 30th birthday party. It was a great idea in theory, but in reality it was like being trapped at a bad wedding. Except instead of an open bar, you have to pay a million dollars per drink and you aren't partying with your drunk relatives, just old strangers. I've heard brunch can be nice though.

fLtqKGUhbOKr_sP23w4Txg.review_text: While visiting a friend in the Bay Area for her birthday, Her husband made reservations for us to have a little night life fun at the Starlight Room in San Francisco. We had reservations for a table by a window which over looks all of the city.  Once we arrived, we were taken to a table immediately.  However, it was located directly by the kitchen.  Which was very busy.  It was Very uncomfortable and had the feel of as if we were apart of the staff. With that being said we turned the table down and asked to be seated at something more inviting.  They ended up moving us to a table on the left side of the restaurant 3 table from the kitchen.  Without complaining we decided to take that table and enjoy the view.  Within minutes our awesome waitress Monica, asked for our drink order and gave some great suggestions.  The birthday girl had a rum punch, her husband Belvi on ice with lime, I had a tipsy rabbit and our other friend had an easy sippin!!!  All I can say is yummy!!!.  With lots of people celebrating Christmas parties, the section to the right of us was being reserved for a wedding.  As the staff had been trying to keep others from wondering over to the area we thought we would help out and suggested that they bring a velvet rope there to show its was a VIP reserved area which they did finally. Chris, the security on site took over the area and from time to time had to walk away.  So again we suggested to Chis that WE would help monitor the area, Since we were sitting right there, so he could handle other area's of the lounge. He was AWSOME!!! Now the mood changes when we get this so called host named Robert.  He comes over to the velvet rope and says to us, "We're gonna move you all. This is the worst table in the house."  When actually he wanted to give our table to another customer and place us back by the kitchen again!!!.  So of course we refused and as he looked down upon us as if we didn't belong in this establishment, we asked Monica to send over the manager. When the manager came to our table not only was he personable but he was so friendly!!! It was if we knew him for years.  His name is Derick Opela!!!! He, Monica and Chris 5 Diamond for this spot.  However that Robert, this place could really do without. Derick took exceptional care of us and sent us all a round of birthday drinks and treated us as if we were royalty.  With the 3 of them on staff we said we would defiantly return to this place.  It ROCKS big time.....even with that ol' evil Robert.

6F0uGYwpJUGxhlMO6C3r_g.review_text: I know it's old and small, and the drinks are spendy, but THIS IS the Starlight room and gives you some great views of the city.   It brings you back to the days of old.   I enjoyed it.  I thought it was cool and it will be on my list of FAVs in San Fran.

3qGo-CYyFIUHVh3Teo-G_g.review_text: I came here for drinks and appetizers. The place is beautiful- you can't beat the view, looking down Union Square or up to the sky on a clear night. And the service was prompt. The food and drinks were nothing memorable- just fine.   The crowd was also significantly older... Not that there's anything wrong with that. I just didn't find this to be aimed at the under 30 crowd (at least not on the Friday night I went- and it wasn't being used as a club). I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here.

m5ssxEA0FTwYpGKi646Rjg.review_text: I got dragged here for a friend's birthday adventure on a Friday night.  I wasn't too impressed with the Starlight Room, but thanks to the trip I do know where to pick up prostitutes in San Francisco.  Seriously, this place should be renamed Harry Denton's Hooker Convention.  They even had a pimp there (or maybe he was just part of Run DMC) making sure his ladies were working their magic on everyone from the older gentlemen with their wedding rings still on to the eurotrash in tracksuits using prepaid mobile phones.  As a 28 year old lady, this place made me remarkably uncomfortable.  It wasn't the ladies of ill repute selling their wares that made feel dirty (I had lots of fun playing hooker or housewife). It was the mass amount of men twice my age who hit on me, a bad cover band, broken glass on the dance floor, watered down cocktails, and a weird musty smell that made me walk out shortly after arriving.

p6VpnzidZzpOPa03TrcK0w.review_text: worth it. just worth it. excellent ambiance I wasn't dissapointed at all. I'm taking my parents here for sure.

ObitDzUawFrc6xdvdhJ_hA.review_text: I really loved the view and the ambiance of the place.  It was $5 for cover when I came around 8:45 pm.  $12 for a Vodka Red Bull, but it tasted slightly sweet and great to me.  ( Our waitress asked me if I preferred a particular vodka flavor and I said no.) The waitresses wore classy but sexy long black dresses.  A few male waiters wore tuxedos.  There was seating and tables.  The live band that night was not my favorite, but they did have a DJ later on.  They do have a piano too, but they did not play on it that night. The dance floor had a mirrored ceiling, which reflected the little white lights on the dance floor.  (The ceiling looked like stars).  We loved the gorgeous views of all of Union Square and even the freeway lights.   It is a twenty one floor elevator ride up to the top, and it is in the Sir Francis Drake Hotel.  There were people there of all ages and styles, but most were in their thirties or older.  My friends and I loved the glamour of the place and will come back in the future.

4LBQJOg86EZAcoiYEjPL0w.review_text: Ok I love this place and have reviewed it before, I have been here over the past 3 years for different occasions. Once for a birthday which was very fun, my husband's company Christmas party which was a blast and great food! Today  September 29th 2013 I went to the noon drag brunch with a friend and we had a blast! This is the perfect blend of brunch, entertainment and just a bit of the cheesy sparkle that the place offers! It was a good mix of people, good food and beautiful entertaining queens! Make sure to arrive early to enjoy brunch.

VpREWOjt5Pna6OIgXI9Jcg.review_text: Cool. Great view. Expensive drinks. They apparently have food, which is probably overpriced. Yadda yadda. I'm not *dying* to come back, but I'd probably recommend it to visitors.  I have a friend in high places (do expatriate techno DJs count as high-place people?) who was performing here one night. I credit him for getting us out on the "balcony" (a fire escape with a nice view where the employees take breaks), so that was pretty cool. The crowd that night was meh (techno ain't really my thing), but the atmosphere of fans + older tourists still didn't bug me.  I give it props for being nice and old-worldy inside, with tons of pictures of Harry Denton and all the famous people who hit up his bar back in the day. Cocktail (just the one at $12 a pop) was good; Cointreau and rum concoction was tasty, but nothing exceedingly special.  it seems like Top of the Mark is their biggest fancy-drink-old-world-bar competition, so I'd still head there first if I'm in the area and looking for an old bar with a view.

IZcByTHZhWnWdfWoL10pVA.review_text: Maybe the place has a great atmosphere and a stunning view of the city, but even combined those certainly doesn't compensate the terrible service that can only be described as pretentious and unorganized. The "manager" that was huffing and puffing around seemed more like he was monitoring a hot dance club roof bar, but someone needs to remind him that its a lounge and that he needs to calm down. After sitting down for awhile and enjoying our drinks, we saw the manager speaking to security about us. Nobody likes being talked about from across a room.  Moments later, the same security guy that checked our ID's came back to say that the manager wanted to check one of our ID's once more. At this point we decided that our presence wasn't welcomed and we left. The only redeeming qualities were the ambience and the live band, but besides that we didn't feel we were wanted there.

l36ud3agBxzBJ88zIeNVfA.review_text: Starlight room is a great spot to celebrate a special evening out. Situated on the 21st floor of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel, the classy club offers beautiful views of San Francisco's city sky scape. Here, the rich, extravagant interior and luxurious lounge chairs are fit for a king. Perfect place to sit back, relax, and sip champagne or a signature "Cable Car" cocktail.  Bar bites include seafood snacks, gourmet pizzas, and fillet mignon sliders. For a sweet treat, enjoy a plate of fresh strawberries, rich chocolate sauce, and sweet cream frache. Nothing screams "special occasion" more!   Continue your night on the dance floor. Live music playing all ages hits in a "wedding party" way. The intimate dance space is surrounded by large, open windows offering romantic 360* views of beautiful city below.   Service is spectacular. The bouncers, bartenders, and helpful hostesses all go the extra mile to make the night one to remember.   Be prepared to pay  the price for the room's royal treatment. Cover is 15 a person and cocktails are costly. But an evening at the Starlight Room is worth every precious penny. Guaranteed to make you're next celebration sweet - the Starlight Room is a delicious San Francisco treat!

uZdFsE_aHbFBChgN6Xa8tw.review_text: This place has great ambiance and the views were amazing.  The service was pretty awesome, especially the guy at the front.  He was really gracious and accommodating.  The waitresses are in long, black prom-like dresses and the door guy was dressed in a tux!  As the Yelp reviews already mention, I saw some cougars and older white men with their younger Asian female counterparts.  But not too many.  Most were tourists or groups having a drink.  They played hip-hop music and have a dance floor.  This place has a lot of fabric (i.e. is dusty) and I kept on sneezing after awhile.    Good place to grab a drink with a friend around Union Square!

8qhMB7cHwrEYI69LVz2Yvg.review_text: I went to a drag brunch here when a friend was in town and the food was really good and the drinks were really good but based on the price I was expecting more. 3 stars deal with it! Jk.. You should go at night and get a punch bowl of something. Especially if you're a tourist in the area.

pBNqvV5IkldL24s418ZzRw.review_text: +1 star - atmosphere  - -  just getting up to the lounge itself adds a load of 'color' to the experience. +1 star - view +1 star - live music +1 star- friendly bar staff +1 star for the bouncer  for letting me in free and giving my friend a discount on the cover charge.  -1 star - for a weird crowd - ghetto/ mixed with cougars/ mixed with sleezy old men / the whole feeling of the place is a little too 'pick-upy' for me. -1 star for charging a cover  i'll go back, but they are not top on my list. Its a nice spot to check out if you are in union square and want to grab a drink.

IpReaQYuXO_nB07xnkHuNw.review_text: Located on the top of the unique and legendary hotel Sir Francis Drake.   I need to quit drinking so much because I don't remember the evening...wait the door girl was a total knock out!  Tall blonde with gorgeous red Dior lip stick......the servers were eye candy!  I remember some Red Wine a cheese plate and old fashioned cocktail....oh yes it's all coming back before I blacked out.  I was dancing by myself and gyrating like a drunken fool...I think the DJ uploaded a video on Vine and hashtagged it #stupidwhitegirl   Great people watching!  Impressive View of the City.  This place is nostalgic only the Real Deals "Get it"

PVpeB-fTAd5qi1vxDTSehw.review_text: Came here on a Wednesday night (Cinco de Drinko to be exact) And it was crowded, music was bumping, drinks were reasonable, but the best thing about this place is the view! It's amazing, if you just go to take a gander at beautiful SF then you are in for a treat. Definitely plan on going again - Wednesday nights I hear its the hot spot, and it was proven correct.

lpNHyguJOj4mO5PWeuVJEg.review_text: This place was inside the Sir Francis Drake Hotel. Very cool inside. Great music, great drinks, and the coolest view of San Francisco! I loved the fried Mac and cheese squares they had for an appetizer. If you are in the city visiting I recommend you come here even if it's just for the view & a drink!

SJV7XYKkWHKe7EPr5_QhAg.review_text: I visited the Starlight Room last night (12/13/2014) on a whim and first time visit. Being the holiday season, there were lots of families waiting to get in with me at 6:00 p.m. Due to the fact that I have kids and don't care to be in "kid friendly places" (mine are grown), it was a pleasant surprise. The staff was super friendly and attentive. I was with a date and we both enjoyed the view, decor and ambiance. This place reminds me of an old skool place where mobsters, gangsters and back room politicians would plan and connive during the Roaring 20s. Red velvet curtains, high ceiling windows, crystal hanging from the ceiling, recessed lighting, skyline views and piano! I felt like lighting a cigar and sipping some $800.00 cognac. But I don't smoke cigars and drink my money.     Our drinks were basic: Amaretto de Saranno and Stella beer. We also had raw Tuna Dip with chips. The chips were bland and reminded me of the Holy Wafers provided at communion. They were flavorless and the Tuna Dip could have used some added flavor. But it was OK and edible.   The bathrooms were super clean and the lint free paper towels were good enough to wash/dry my car with. I would come back for drinks with a stunning view and super friendly staff.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: Star light, star bright,  The first star I see tonight;  I wish I may, I wish I might,  Have the wish I wish tonight.  *Opens Eyes**  WTH, I didn't wish for a room full of Sugar Daddies!!!  I was going to give Starlight Room 2-3 stars after my nightlife experience on 11/10; however, this wouldn't be fair since most clubs can't control the type of crowd they attract/bring in. I also had to take into account the company holiday party I organized here 3 years ago, hence the 4 Stars.  ***N I G H T L I F E*** Since we had Veterans Day off, my friends and I wanted to party the night before. I remember hearing about Wed (Indulgence) Hip Hop Nights hosted by Sebastien Entertainment, so we decided to give it a shot.  LINE: We got there at 10:30 PM and the wait was less than 2 mins.  COVER:  Free before 11 PM, if you're on the GL; otherwise it's $10.  DRESS CODE: Although no dress code was stated on the FB invite, SR is not a place to come rocking your newest kicks. It's a very classy venue, so dress to impress!  CROWD: SUGAR DADDY AND COUGAR CENTRAL! The average age was about 50--I kid you NOT! There was probably a 3:1 ratio of men to women and the majority were tourists. It wasn't our scene, so we left to Infusion. I think the crowd is a result of the event being under promoted.   MUSIC: Top 40s, Hip Hop and Pop. Guest DJ Primetyme was awesome; good mixes and smooth transitions. The music was so good; we even contemplated coming back here after leaving to Infusion.   BAR: There's a main bar upon entering SR and a make-shift one near the dance floor. They have an extensive array of liquor including many rare and expensive ones.   DRINKS: $11 for top shelf liquor which is reasonable considering it's an upscale venue in a historic downtown hotel. Generous shots were served in cups.   Bottle service was available for $150/ bottle for Absolut and $200/bottle for Goose which probably needs to be booked ahead of time from the promoters to lock in this price.   AMBIANCE/DÉCOR: SR is very classy and reminiscent of the 1930s with deep red velvet booths and draping, diamond chandeliers and staff decked out in a white tux and black bow tie. There are about 6-8 booths reserved for bottle service. The dance floor is pretty tiny and probably the size of 4 cubicles. There's PLENTY of dancing room as most of the crowd wasn't the dancing type.   The main attraction is the GORGEOUS 360-degree view of San Francisco. It's truly breathtaking to see a bird eye's view of SF's landmarks and the city lights on a crisp night. SR is definitely a great place to bring out-of-towners or a date for drinks.  PARKING: Street parking is difficult but not impossible at night. I got parking 1.5 blocks away after circling just once. Otherwise, there's valet parking.   ***P R I V A T E  E V E N T*** Since I organized a company holiday party 3 years ago, my review is very dated and lacks precise detail. However, the customer service was excellent and I didn't have a panic attack, so it's very noteworthy. (Do note that SR is open to the public at 9:30 PM.)   Jaime, the Events Manager at the time was very easy to work with. She was very friendly, professional and responsive. She always responded to my calls and/or e-mails within 24 hours.   I told Jaime our company budget and she gave us several options on how we can maximize our budget. She helped us work out a plan so that we can offer unlimited red and white wine. And, as a surprise she even had the bartender make a specialty cocktail with our company color which we handed out drink tickets for.   We ordered 2 stations: North Beach Station (antipasti and various pastas) and Chinatown Station (dim sum dishes). Although the stations were suppose to be more like hors d'oeuvres, the food portions were very generous so everyone was well fed. I did have some doubts about the lack of authenticity of the Chinatown Station, but was told that they have Chefs that specialize in each region of cuisine. And, from what I remember, the har gow, sui mai, and char siu bao tasted similar to what you get in Chinatown, Sunset, or Richmond.  DJ Dave Gillis is SR's in-house DJ, so we didn't have to bother looking for one. DJ Gillis was very easy to work with as well. He sent me playlists to look through beforehand and played songs that suited our employees. Most of our workforce was engineers, so needless to say, there was no Flo Rida's "Get Low" or Kelis' "Milkshake".   As far as the event went, it went off without a hitch. My former colleagues aren't party animals, but everyone enjoyed the food and getting to mingle with each other outside of work. I got commendation for days about how well the event went, but I have to thank the staff at SR for helping to organize a successful event that was virtually stress-free.   All in all, although the nightlife crowd was not my cup of tea, I would come back to SR for the music and venue not without good company of course...

7e3aUxxnArwmOp7EzyBOuw.review_text: Overall we were disappointed with our experience. Our waitress was rude at first and forgot to place our food order. After about 20 mins, we got our punch bowl drink, which was fun! Then about 45 mins after we sat down and our order of Mac and cheese and chicken nuggets still were not here, we requested our check. Needless to say, I would not recommend this place besides the view and punch bowl bur defiantly don't order food.

6xSbtQsu_X4erlm3l0PxZA.review_text: I was there last Saturday. The door guy there pretty rude. I am arrived a little bit passed 10:30pm and I tried to bargain with them because their website said Guestlist close at 11 not 10:30. He just simply showed me the exit. I actually call them twice before this event and want them confirm with me this schedule. but nobody call me back. If I did not have a group of friends wait for me inside already, I will argue with them.

g-izCxO8zgvkIGaGOqdk-w.review_text: Wonderful night! Bit of a fuss to get in as they had a private party first, so they opened late. Had to wait in the lobby downstairs in the bar. Music was great. Motown and current music was wonderful. Danced for hours! tables were reserved at a fee so we stood or danced. Mixed crowd, 20-50s mostly couples dancing.  Great drinks on the pricey side. Superb view of the city

Lp4ofPjCh1VRklL_j2Eqlw.review_text: hmmmmm this place was kinda fun and exclusive....  I like the fact that it was at the top floor of the hote, and overlooked the city. I was at a press realease shoot for designs by Danielle Pette (She's awesome!) And my secreto crush came with me (He's awesome) unexpetedly had a hellova time. I'd definitely go back.
