7bAnU8PIEmAV_tUeaIdCaw.review_text: This place has damn sketchy wait staff, my husband charged $250 on his AE and when he checked his bank statement, the staff added extra tip on his bill! Seriously, wtf. Can't imagine how often they've gotten away with that. My husband has reported them to AE to dispute the charge. Manager needs to figure out what's going here.

l-ECea3knk6W_euS6-dSag.review_text: Sunday's a Drag - HOLIDAY EDITION  (that is the name of the Sunday Brunch at the Starlight Room).  This is something that has been going on for a few years, so a group of us decided to go.  You get two things when you go - a buffet brunch and drag show.    Brunch - Um, 2 stars.  Not the best.  You had an omelet bar which was probably the best part.  They have a meat carving station - not sure what the meat was but it was pretty bland and you had to ask for more than one piece if you wanted more (and you will because they give you a pretty skinny piece).  Bacon was good.  Other stuff was okay - nothing fancy or very tasty.  Holiday Drag show was fantastic.  Hosted by Donna Sachet - she does a great job.  All of the performers were fantastic as well.  They definitely have the performance down!  The holiday show was great, because at the end you get snow.  Oh, and don't be surprised if you go and get pulled up on stage!

9d45b2HFZUTffGP3MwzNyQ.review_text: Five stars for the view, four stars for the kitschy, bordello-like decor complete with red velvet seats, heavy drapery and doorman in a tux (their schtick I guess), and 3 stars for the drinks (too pricey and was not bowled over, did not even finish it).  Love, Love, Love it though when the DJ played "I left my heart in San Francisco" as the last song of the night.  Just the right note to end a wonderful evening with friends, complete with the blinking lights of Union Square.  A place to visit if you are ever lucky enough to visit the Bay.

-_VJmFYr8yIZL4rF9GI9TA.review_text: Saw the drag show as a groupon customer. It was great that they allowed one groupon per person at the tables. The place was overly made up, a left over from another age and just plain cheesy.  Perfect for a drag brunch!  They were entertaining for an an audience that was composed mostly of tourists, and folks like us, drag aficionados.  The "gals" were talented. The brunch itself was fair,. And the service was passable. Overall, it was worth the groupon price we each

fgfDltv6iJMImzG8D39nMw.review_text: What the hell?! When did this place turn into a hyphy club with a $15 entrance fee?! It was really busy and I know the views are amazing but it's way too stuffy & crowded. So hard to get to the bar. There were older people dressed up as if they're going to a gala mixed in with young people who were wearing nothing but what seemed like a long t-shirt.  We ended up going downstairs to the lobby and then elsewhere for a drink.

m3f1x02-81PfN-3LnIzOlg.review_text: Went on a Friday night, and the coverage was only $5? I thought it was $10 last time I went.  View: I didn't think it was that spectacular, maybe because it was foggy that night. The building isn't high enough, or isn't situated high enough so you get blocked by other buildings around.   Music: went in at around 10, the music was for the older crowd. I didn't know the music, but i knew they were not normal club music for the young. Tried to dance, but it was awkward, maybe I am awkward. Most people dancing around that time are old. However, as it gets later in the night, the music changed to the normal club music, which makes the room HOT!  Drink: reasonably priced. Folks, this is one of the best spot in SF, so no $5 cocktail OK? go to a college bar or something if you are looking for cheap drinks. The cocktails were well made, my Cable Car was very very tasty. I licked the cinnamon on the rim...YUM!  Restroom: amazingly clean!! Unlike many other club/bar when it gets late and drunk people start puking.  Host: the host who led us to the seat was a sweetheart! He watched my purse when I left it on the seat and hit the dance floor. By the time I came back, he gave me a little sweet talk, warning me that there are people here just waiting for purses like that to be left on the seat.  Overall, it's a great experience. As busy as it is around union square, I didn't have much trouble finding street parking around at night both time I went there.

lppwCBZaoOZrCStDXO6lnQ.review_text: The bouncer staff with ego is so rude and condescending that I do not recommend this place. The bouncers are vulgar.

_3TzyX5mRpA8Afubqp6g9Q.review_text: Aside from the nice view of the city, this is the sort of place I could see myself in when I was in college trying to impress a girl or seam classier than I actually was.  It's very much a vodka tonic or heineken beer place.  I feel like it's also a decent place for NYE, again, if you're trying to impress someone.  I really did not like how when I first stepped into the lounge the bouncer grabs me in the chest region, as if I were storming the beaches, and says something to the effect of "ID and WHERE DO YOU THINK YOU'RE GOING!".  I mean, c'mon dude you're 2 feet taller and have about 200lbs on me.  We needed to walk through a curtain in order to enter the lounge, and proceed to the checkin.  Did the bouncers need to flex his authority at that point?  Was I going to checkin and make a run for the bar to choke down as much alcohol before he got to confirm my ID?  Maybe once I figure out how to move faster than the speed of light that abruptly stopping someone when they first walk in might necessary as a pre-caution.  Tsk tsk

eCPeMIEAjOpzq5ArgS_tBg.review_text: Very cool place... love the atmosphere and ambiance

M-OyDg7UU0RKJh70GkDuHQ.review_text: I think the only thing that I liked about this place was the view and the well mixed drinks.  Maybe my experience here wasn't that great because I was clearly the youngest person there that night and they weren't really playing the kind of music I was used to. This lounge is pretty small with booths and tables on both sides and a very small dancefloor by the window. Overall I just wasn't feeling this place and left after just two drinks.

VoyMYXTMDDqXfAbyZsM5pQ.review_text: Went there for the first time this last weekend. They had an awesome band, good drinks, nice atmosphere and friendly people. It was pretty hopping too. Maybe a little older crowd, but it's more of a mature atmosphere, if you want to get wasted and hit on chicks I suggest go to a cheap bar. I was there on a date with my boyfriend and it was great :) I'm definitely going to go back!

WzgTJg1cWYsFMCZKLHd8-w.review_text: Sunday Drag Brunch = $45 Drinks at brunch ~$10 each The look on your face when you realize the woman in front of you was a man = priceless  Front row seats, a plate full of food and lots of singing, big hair, and boobs.  If you're an Asia SF fan, I would recommend this show for brunch with out of town guests.    The food was meh.  And the show is definitely entertaining for men - I feel like women aren't as interesting to the ladies on stage... but come for the experience.   Afterwards, you'll feel motivated to go hit the gym because everyone on stage is in freakin' great shape.

5qZb6nLd7gRnTQK6OKwAPg.review_text: if you are staying at the drake already, and want a lively place to grab a drink, a bite, and listen to live music...its definitely a default choice. i dont agree with a "discounted' cover to hotel guests, but it is what it is.  we came up to this top level lounge on the first nite of our stay around 11pm friday night. the place was happening and seating was very limited..dance floor was full. quite tough getting a window table to enjoy the spectacular view. there was a very lively cover band playing a wide assortment of top 40s music from different eras. it was loooooud, but fun.  shared the baked mac n cheese - totally different that i expected. they are 3 fried breaded macaroni balls rather than regular baked version. delicious, no doubt, but a little small in the portion.  Quite the extensive specialty cocktail menu...you really cant be disappointed by any choice. they are the typical high prices ($12-$14) but high end ingredients and thoughtfully made. however my final tanqueray 10 and tonic was just as delicious to me and a much larger portion.

0-b7saOcK9M6GT9SNrRDlg.review_text: We went to the Starlight room on March 8th. There was a special put on by Frenchy le Freak.  The music was awful. All House music, loud and obnoxious.  I have been to Harrys many times and there is often the same problem.  Many people eager and willing to dance.  No good dance music.  Try and ask the DJ or the management to play danceable music and they blow you off. In the meantime, patrons stand around waiting for a decent song. After 30 minutes most people leave in disgust after paying their $20 cover charge.  This place puts on like they care about their patrons, but they simply don't.  They have their own agenda.

M4x7LkzUqKoRNlV42uFo7A.review_text: came here with my buddy a few days back. First off, the girls look like second hand dolls, which to me is a complete turnoff. We go to order our drinks (expensive) and she laughs at me. Five minutes later , some panzy ass in a black bow tie inspects my id for like 2 minutes and then tells me that he will not accept it.  NEVER GO HERE . nothing is worse then a shitty place with a shittier staff

VHdY6oG2JPVNjihWhOooAQ.review_text: This place is such a trip.  It reminds me of hotel bars in Qatar - with the random assortment of people who all seem to look so out of place, but yet so in place here. I am always amazed how such a kooky group of people, all make their way out to the Starlight Room- to drunkenly and awkwardly attempt to dance on a dance floor  - overlooking all of San Francisco.  It's genius. That's what it is.  Seeing some unshaven hipster couple bust out moves beside a graying couple - her squeezed into a way too tight sequin dress - while he dons an awkward fitting Dockers blazer and tapered khaki pants,  makes me smile.  I love it.  I appreciate that the dance floor is just as entertaining as the phenomenal view - through the big glass windows lining the dance floor. And when I say phenomenal - I mean it - a breathtaking view of downtown San Francisco and Union Square.  But view and amazingly strange crowd aside, there is something off about the Starlight Room. While it's fun to visit on one off occasions - it's not the kind of place I'd necessarily roll into regularly.  There's a bizarre cheesy factor to the place - which can be exciting at times - because you never know who you're going to be standing next to, or talking to; but at the same time - it's just that: a surreal world - where you just don't really know who you're talking to.   The Starlight Room seems strangely familiar - but at the same time - cold and unbalanced. It's not the kind of place that I would want to step into alone. There's just wayyyyyyyy to many strange characters walking around here.  My advice on how to best enjoy this space: dress up and go on a fun date here. Cuddle into one of their dimly lit booths. Or go with a group of friends who can appreciate quality people watching. Because this place delivers. And then some.  Trust.

5l4td5Hyf_aGfE8ZYJBaYw.review_text: A great place for a drink and a chat. The cocktails were amazing. Old Havana for me please, while my wife enjoyed a Bella (peach puree with lemon, pineapple & cranberry juices). Although drinks were great, I would only give the appetizers 3* and would pass next time.  Now, the 260-degree, top floor city views, on the other hand, only added to the already romantic and elegant ambiance. A place really set in time. The view, drinks and excellent service will make you return again and again.

_KBhBafbDBagR4wtNUijNA.review_text: Just visited the Starlight Room, at 10p on a Saturday night, as an out of town visitor looking forward to celebrating my birthday at a classy establishment. Here are my findings:  $10 cover/person. Right off the bat, they charged me.   Ordered two drinks from the bar, vodka tonic and rum and coke (well drinks at that). $19. Ouch. After the $10 cover?? I'm from Los Angeles and I still found that outrageous...  Music, straight out of the nineties, if not earlier. Only one song was played from this decade and that was Macklemore's "Thrift Shop". If you're looking for a hot spot to dance in, this is not it. Dance floor was filled with older folks who are probably staying at the hotel. Want to see 50 year olds jitterbug to Prince? This is your place! Plus the DJ clearly did not know what he was doing, as he would play one upbeat song, and then immediately play three songs that all you could do was step to.   After all that dancing, I figured it would be nice to sit. NOPE. All the tables were reserved, which really takes away from the ambiance, when you can't sit in their pretty red booths (part of what drew me there in the first place).  All in all, a DISAPPOINTING experience. If you've never been there, I wouldn't go expecting much. I'm sure the drag brunch is great, but seeing as I already spent $40+ to be disappointed, I'll not spend the extra $90 to see if their drag queens are as good as ours.

ISqKwmeNqMB1EdHBk9Tktg.review_text: Good views. Okay cocktails. Terrible service. Don't go here unless you don't mind being late to whatever you're doing afterwards.

ZpE3x2SerjBqYGcKr0HJWw.review_text: This used to be the place to party on a Wednesday night. It's gotten really old, however. Not old as in "Peter Pan Syndrome" 20-and-30-somethings. Old as in...Fifty-somethings.  Everyone has a right to party, but I'm gonna have to find a different Wednesday night scene.

yaQo-D2iRS8boc2kE3wxHw.review_text: This place has a spectacular view of San Francisco and a great selection of wine, scotch, and beer. I would highly recommend heading here for a drink one night just for the view if not for any other reason.

xE3gLCGvWYleB-WJPUWC5w.review_text: Beautiful views of Union Square and some good looking people to watch. The live bands are always great!  Nice central location, too.

TZelLnaGbHgaG7LBI6rfgg.review_text: The people watching is hilarious. The view of the city is nice but you will see some strange. Creepy out of towners and old people making out like teenagers sends out the weird vibes. This place is for your old uncle after popping some Viagra. Drinks were so-so.

Sz0B_4T9K8FLrx5Bqob-Lw.review_text: Easter 420 Sunday is a Drag brunch buffet. Food was delicious and the show was very very entertaining. I can definitely see why the show has been going on every Sunday for 8 years. Thank you to Michael (producer) for putting on such a great show at a terrific venue

AHI4Ew--zYhs0m8npEd65g.review_text: Eclectic crowd makes for some interesting people watching. Broad generalization would be tourists and 'bridge and tunnel', people having a good time, but the venue feels kitschy and not quite worth the $15 cover.   I went during holiday party season, so quite a few cocktail dresses, in addition to typical SF jeans and t-shirt look.   Nice view of Union Square from the dance floor, though it was so steamy in there that it looked blurry even after rubbing the windows. Semi crowded dance floor, and dancing itself was barely ok... music was eclectic to the point that the DJ must not have been watching the crowd (or didn't care) that when he drastically changed genres he lost half of his dance floor.  Might be ok with a table, but long wait at bar (though stiff drinks)

Mj5f9C-rVEuMDgmMW3Zm3w.review_text: Oh how I do love the starlight room!!!!  This was my 5th or 6th time here. A definite must for me when I go to union square. This is one of the best views in SF.  We arrived around 1pm on Sunday after some shopping. What a great choice! It was drag queen Sunday, like all Sunday's! We were seated at the bar & offered prime seats for the show for free! Nice!!!!!!  The bartender was great. He asked where we were from. Me, being a resident of the east bay was not nearly as interesting as my friend from Idaho. Why!?!? Because the owner is from Idaho. He came over about 5 minutes later, told us some stories & bought us a round. How very awesome is that?   Such a great time at the starlight room, as always! A must go place in union square.

xB7WBew_ZM196sPBCoO3Bg.review_text: Old school lounge with killer view. Love the 70's style dresses worn by the waitresses.  Takes me back to the old days. Drinks are VERY strong.  Almost too much. Matre'd was very nice. Dance floor very small.

IKTyFlE_VsoFyapciSP2Rg.review_text: My friend and I happened to be walking by one evening and decided to pop into the Starlight Room. I know it's a novelty bar and has great views, if you can get a seat by the window, but the drinks just weren't that great, especially for $15 a piece and the company wasn't super fun. Maybe next time I stop in I will make a point of coming with a larger group of friends and ordering beer instead of the super sweet sugary mixed drinks behind the bar.

dvC9oGW_30ofJsGMBlNdhA.review_text: This review is for Sundays a Drag brunch. It's a fun environment but a very small room. Brunch food was just ok. The performers varied. The emcee was the only one who actually sang. Everyone else lip synced and danced around.  The "Single Ladies" performance was very good.,,she had the moves down. And Cassandra was amazing as she was stunning with a great body, but her talent seemed to be just how great she looks as a woman. I also don't think she's technically a drag queen as it seems she may actually be transgender. But I'm splitting hairs. It's a fun way to spend a Sunday afternoon, but probably not something I'd do twice.

ZIR96Kh35GvW2eLyQHJh1Q.review_text: Miss seeing Harry Denton at this venue as he really made the place one of the fun "go to" places in the city for drinks. Here's to you Harry!

PeIL3tQikUInID2tWEBEJg.review_text: I am writing this review especially for the  'Sunday's Are A Drag' Brunch.  First of all..... The Starlight Room looks great in the day light.  They lightly block the windows, and create a Stage in the center of the main room.  For the brunch ...... a buffet of quite good food.  Everything from Chicken and Waffles,  French Toast, an Omelette Station, Prime Rib Carving Station, all kinds of yummy things....  Good desserts, and a selection of juices..... They encourage you to go back multiple times.  Extra points for the guy who busses the empty plates!  He does not let dirty dishes linger!  Then.... it is Showtime.  I've seen Donna Sachet around for years.... but.... I had no idea how talented she really is.  She is the Star of the show, and the MC.  She sings in her own voice..... and is completely hysterical when she is talking with the audience.  She goes by every table, and makes everyone feel so welcome..... like she is doing the show just for them.  She looks every person in the eye as she makes her rounds.  The other performers are fantastic...... Each one with a different style.  My Republican parents LOVED it!  I did not tell them it was a drag show till we got there!

TpZN51jtAZTu7BjYxTfpjA.review_text: Absolutely beautiful. I went here for Valentine's Day weekend. It was so much fun to get to go to the top floor of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel. The view was incredible. Windows wrap all the way around the restaurant. There were beautiful chandeliers and the booths had 1930's style stripes. I can't wait to come back for a meal in the daytime and just look at the view. The dance floor is small but there are windows on 3 sides of it. The night I was there they alternated between a live band and a DJ. Both of which were fun to dance to. The crowd is pretty varied. It is 21 and up but I would say its geared more towards over 30 but it really varies. The Starlight Room is perfect for a night of getting dressed up and celebrating in a beautiful location.

7eR3QevWrQAFyrtVpFksdA.review_text: Pretty fun place for a drink, but not sure it beats the alternatives in the area.   We came by on a weeknight and ordered two pretty tasty gin and tonics- a little pricey but not outlandishly so.   The place is big and feels very plush- must be all the red velvet. It definitely looks like a "Starlight Room", I think I heard "fun-bougie" being thrown around.   The view is nice, although it can't quite compete with The View (the bar) down the street.  There were a good number of people there but its spread out enough not to feel cramped. Patrons seemed to be in the 30-40ish range.   We finished our drinks and were ready to head out when the waitress stopped by with two more cocktails on the house. I'm not sure what we did to deserve them (or who chose the drinks), but we were pretty jazzed (the Starlight Room demands words like "jazzed").   Mine was an appropriately cool old fashioned, my friend got something in a sugared martini glass that tasted like a snickerdoodle. We really enjoyed both- not sure how much of that was the free talking.  If I get comped drinks every time I come here this is a six star place, for now I'm leaving it at a solid three. It sounds like you have to see the Sunday performance to really experience the S-Room, so maybe I'll be back soon.

D9K_YU9k-sesZCEIDykBYw.review_text: Despite the "mature" crowd and stodgy decor (including but not limited to the male employees in tuxes and women dressed like Vanna White a la Wheel of Fortune), my girlfriends and I had fun dancing the night away here. No lines and it helped that we were hotel guests... as guests we only paid $5 cover as opposed to $10. I think $10 is a little ridiculous for this "club" to charge. The dance floor is teeny tiny and despite them playing Top 40, it's not very hip -- their live band ran us off the dance floor a few times -- but I suppose the view is worth it.  Bonus? We all hit the sack at different times so it was really convenient to just take the elevator down to our rooms. Bottom line: If you're not staying here and you're under the age of 35, I wouldn't make this a destination, esp. if you're looking to get your groove on.   Minus stars for: -Price for what you get: drinks are rather expensive and watered down... 1 gimlet + 1 Ketel One Vodka Cranberry ran me $22!  -Older crowd (like 50+!) -Decor/live band

VZpzm3HG_YXPHvY97m05qg.review_text: What can I say except I never laugh out loud or LOL and I did this Sunday morning! What a fantastic performance, I had the time of my life.  We even met Harry and he is larger than life!   The food was very good, the service outstanding, but we didn't go for the food or service, that was an added bonus, we went for the performance and we will go back when we visit San Francisco again.  The performers were engaging, entertaining, talented and beautiful.  The majority of the patron's were women, stagette's, birthday's or celebrating something a special occasion.  Don't wait for a special occasion, take your lover, your best friend or your parents, it's a hoot!  Can't wait to go back!

qkreXL6AorI19QA3f2wvlQ.review_text: My roommate had her birthday brunch here (for the Sunday's a Drag show) and I thought it was a great way to celebrate!  The buffet brunch had a good selection.  There was bacon, salads, eggs benedict, potatoes, an omelet station, and mini pastries.  The drinks, unfortunately, were not a part of the deal.  The average price of a cocktail was $11.  And I thought the ladies rocked the show!  I wish it was longer.  As the hostess said, they've been doing the show for 8 years so they're doing something right.  I should mention that there were 13 of us, so we were charged with a 23% service fee.  I thought the standard was 18% for parties over 6... we didn't question it.  I do recommend this place, but be sure you have about 4 in your party.

94IbXzn6zlF7AIVntUlTkQ.review_text: This place scams their customers. I used my card to buy two drinks and even left a generous tip for the bartender, but when I looked at my bank statement, the charge was also 50 instead of 25.  Aside from that the crowd is not so interesting most of the time and there are a lot of tourists. It is very hot inside, though all this would be ok probably as long as they did not steal my money.

ivEzGpzPowGWSMjIn041vw.review_text: The Starlight Room reminds me of 38 year-old Texan women with bleached blond hair, bad make-up, a strong scent of cigarettes and cheap perfume, and a head full of memories from her glory days as a Senior when she led the cheer leading squad during the championship year.  Sure, she once succeeded and had her time in the sun-- who doesn't like a hot Texas cheerleader strutting her stuff on a winning team; the sex appeal is overwhelming-- but those times are past and so is the shiny veneer that came with it.   Enter Harry Denton's Starlight Room at the picturesque apex of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel (note: you could copy and paste this review and it would work perfectly for the SFD Hotel).  Adorned with photos of Harry himself, arm-in-arm which C-list celebrities who once frequented his nightclub and were so desperate for attention they braved the fabulously unhip locale of Union Square and the tourists that come with it, The Starlight Room is that cheerleader: head fully of glory, facade that was oh-so-pretty 20 years ago, and a flood of tourists coming to relive her past every night of every day since then.

Jl7wukjs3Y0WSQOQQ1vkgw.review_text: I came here to see Hubert Keller so I can't really say what it's like on a regular night. The venue itself is kind of small, but you do get spectacular views of the city, and the interior has a cool Art Deco style design. It was really nice to grab a table and enjoy the view and music. There weren't too many people so we were able to move around on the small dance floor also.  I really wasn't expecting Hubert Keller to be such an energetic DJ. He seemed so composed on Top Chef Masters, but the man behind Fleur de Lys knows how to party! He was fist pumping, clapping, dancing, and was just really getting into it. There also was a live saxophonist that played along with Keller's EDM set, which added a cool acoustic effect. His energy was infectious, and it looked like everyone had a good time. I know I did. Now I feel more inclined to try his restaurants.   I also want to apologize to the pretty, blonde waitress for questioning her about whether I got the correct drink. I feel like such a dick. Sorry.

Xb-HKe1tQHf3NloRZ61c8Q.review_text: During the winter holidays, a group of us meet up at the Starlight Room to kick off our  Xmas season revelry. We sip champagne, down oysters, and dance the night away. And yes, the city views are amazing. The space is dark and the seating is cushy. It's a very sexy setting.   I've been to the SLR enough to say there is no one type of crowd that goes here. Oh wait, I take that back. I believe that the majority of the crowd have enough bank to afford the evening.

7kPR3NAhl72EGbUU1h9FOw.review_text: I don't really care about the food or drink - the view is awesome, and it is a great place to go dancing.

KRD6DnENASTunFRbxPpS5w.review_text: Loved this place!  Who doesn't love the Starlight Room?  I spent NYE here and had the best New Year's ever!  My friend Robert and I stayed in the hotel(Sir Francis Drake).  I got divorced and Robert is a really hot, funny guy who I met at a single's dance.  I love funny men and he makes me laugh!  He also has the best swagger!  I love to watch him walk!  My Fellow Good Yelp Ladies, you know what I'm talking about right?  A guy who can swagger has the shoulder and butt action going on!  Watch a a quarterback walk. That's a swagger.  Oh, so anyway, back to the Starlight Room!   Dinner was fabulous, and included a bottle of champagne.  Dessert was wonderful and our server gave us extra chocolate things!  The band was Club 90, and played great dance music. The view of the city was spectacular from the 21st floor of the hotel.  Happy New Year to All My Fellow Good Yelpers!

bPox6BywQJpLaTqQcvOV3g.review_text: This place was a life saver! I was in Frisco for 3 days during the week and had a hard time finding a club scene on a Wednesday night. This was probably the only place that was bumpin that day! Indulgence was what saved us. The place was a full blown dance club on a Wednesday night!  Other than the event, the place was really fancy! We only paid $10 cover and felt like we should have paid $30 or more. The dance floor was surrounded by a 180 degree view of the city, NICE! Coat check was free, but a tip was appreciated.  I had to give it 4 stars because the place did get very very crowed! The dance floor was impenetrable and still, more people were piling in.  If you don't mind a very crowded club, then this place is great, even on a Wednesday night!

ghaEnX_Wzc8Vfc1kVm_NAQ.review_text: Disclaimer: This is for the "Sunday's a Drag" brunch and not the evening festivities.  My first foray into drag shows, and I was definitely entertained!  Like many of the other recent reviewers, I was drawn in by the Groupon bargain.  Rather than being treated like second class patrons, the host courteously gave us a couple of options on seating for the brunch/show.  They manage to cram in more guests than you'd expect, but everyone seemed to have a decent view.  I'd recommend getting the earliest reservation available for your show, so you can leisurely enjoy your brunch prior to all the excitement.  Favorites among the cuisine included the omelet bar, carving station, vegetarian frittatas, and chocolate dipped strawberries.  Their drip coffee was also decent (always a plus).  The show was hilarious, and we especially enjoyed the drunken appearance of Judy Garland!  Minor drawbacks:  It happened to be a warm day and their air conditioning (or lack thereof) could not keep up.  The omelet chefs had a hard time keeping up-- they just needed another person, but they were all very friendly.

HMpS1FtXonXGp-bBjpeySQ.review_text: Dear Harry Denton,  I love you. There, I said it. I'm not so much *in* love with you, but I do love you.... Before you say anything, wouldn't you like to know why?!  Oh Harry, nobody throws a party like you! Your recent addition of "Sunday's A Drag Brunch" to the Starlight Room has made my partying life nearly complete. Now, If I could get my boobs to resemble those of Cassandra Cass from the show, well, I'd be set!  After a weekend of excessive partying in Fog City to celebrate one of my last nights out as a "Single Lady", my girlfriends and I settled in for a delicious brunch, and one of the BEST drag shows I've ever seen. I'm not sure what it is about Drag Queens, but I love them. Maybe it's all the work the girls put in to looking SO beautiful, the sheer showmanship of it all, or the fact that they just seem to LOVE to celebrate. And well, let's be honest, I WAS celebrating my last fling before that ring goes on for good!  The peach Bellinis flowed almost as well as the gowns, and the food was decadent. Fresh made omelets, juicy prime-rib, some of the best lox I've ever tasted, and brioche French toast to top it all off.   But you should know, I was sad to have missed you at this performance. I know you enjoy a visit on most Sunday's. I hope you don't mind, though, when a woman sitting near me asked if her mate would recognize you had you been there, I chimed in with, "Oh, Mr. Denton is hard to miss. A fairly short and some-what stocky man with a great laugh, you'd know if he had been here..." And I ended with a heavy sigh, because I did miss you.  I hope to see you soon, Harry!  With love and admiration,  Lady Lauren

h7Qb2VZwNstP84ntwfJJZQ.review_text: What a great time we had last Sunday at the Sunday's A Drag show in the Starlight Room at the Sir Francis Drake Hotel. The brunch buffet was well stocked and good quality and the drinks were well prepared. The fun drag  show was hosted by the very entertaining and very talented Donna Sachet. Ms. Sachet sings all her own songs (no lip syncing for her!) This is a perfect destination for locals and for visitors who what to have a bit of the San Francisco Drag Queen experience.

yydyomdMdpq0KlkjvVO6Ww.review_text: While this place has a wonderful view, I don't think it is worth the cover charge, or the pretentious attitude from the guy at the door or the mystery man at the podium who decides if you get a table or not, to sit down. If you like snobby, pretentious, cheesy, and not sitting down when you are drinking and dancing, than this is your place. Personally, I used to like Harry Denton's when it was down by the Embarcadero. When it was there, it was more fun and more down to earth.

M7gGHFf369yjYFBGv9bgsg.review_text: I guess that the Starlight Room is doing very well financially because they don't seem to need any extra business.  I left a message for them to call me back because I was interested in planning a birthday party there.  I never got a call back.  When I decided to call again I talked to the manager and he finally got the guy who handles the private events on the phone for me.  The whole attitude turned me off.  Yes he answered my questions but I thought that he was going to fall asleep because he was so bored talking to me.  Needless to say I won't be going here.

NT8fCV65ipHfa00SlxtHEg.review_text: I asked where the smoking section was and the pretentious door man that checked my ID said on the first floor on the side walk!  He could have said he don't have a smoking section instead of being such a smart a**.  The crowd consisted of sleazy guys that did not know when to stop staring and prostitutes...not like I have a problem with working girls..I just don't want to hanging out on their corner them.  It was fishy was poorly lit! This is what hell must be like! One plus was the view!!

_W5k3gq6VN-lKho9JNsVpw.review_text: Bunch of old people behaving like teens grinding on each other. I was in shock. Only nice part is the views and the strong drinks. I think the staff should have controlled some of these people, especially the older lady who flashed everyone her genitals. I felt like I was at a comedy club the whole night watching old people get down to Rick Ross the boss. Not coming here again.

zqttuCEWI4-l4ZBCbfGk6A.review_text: I can definitely see how someone would think that this place is a touch on the cheesy side, but there's something about it that I like. The views are amazing -- clearly the selling point here -- and the drinks and service are good. I really (really!) like how they lay out their menu, decade by decade, with drinks to match. It's a fun concept and the drinks that I've tried are definitely well executed. The overall vibe is kind of old school San Francisco with a little tourism factor, but there is live music in the evenings (at least on the weekends) which I find pretty fun! In terms of VIEWS,  I would take the Top of the Mark over Harry Denton's, but I think both provide pretty views for people visiting the city.

Yl51zC35TypS5n3k4vJVBg.review_text: Wow. So rude and inconsiderate! I'm shocked. The owner/manager was defending his belligerently rude server. Can never come here again sadly.

cY_Yf-uMGW5meHtIyl5neA.review_text: Came here with my sissy for Sunday's a Drag ($44.95 per person, not including gratuity).  Made reservations for the 12PM show and brunch was served at 11AM.  Reservations are probably recommended since the place is somewhat small and most tables were filled up when we were there.    The starlight room itself was pretty and gaudy; old school like.  Tables were a bit close and space was cramped.  I was also a bit disappointed that I didn't really get to see the view since all the curtains were down.    Food itself was presented nicely, but it was just okay.  The buffet area was small and I wish they had a bigger selection.  They had an ommelette station, a carving station, and platters of french toast, eggs benedicts, chicken and waffles, pastries, fruits, sausages, bacon, and salads.  I know, listing it out sounds a lot, but it really wasn't     The show itself was quite entertaining and they really try to make you laugh.  Not sure if I'll come back though, trying it out once is kind of good enough for me.    20% gratuity will be included on your bill, regardless of party size.

abcHXT-6HatHmKmBdwkgyg.review_text: What a fun place to have gone for a drink - beautiful open view - didn't see the sunset but I'll try it again during the summer time ..seats could be a bit more comfortable but the drinks and small apps were great.  The service was prompt and on point ....they do shows here but I was too hungry to hang out for that.

EYgUvu8gfXMguAxc8hNwjw.review_text: 5 star view of Union Square and the City!  Worth the price of the cocktail alone!

CPl5ARtHgAeDJ0MHO4-zTw.review_text: My Wife and I came here on Friday maybe Thursday I cant really remember for a night topper. We entered and where greeted by a nice young man (Derek) who we later found out was the manager.  Anyway he sat us by a window near the dance floor. He asked if we had ever been to The Starlight Room. we told him no and that we where here from GA. He told us he was also from there and moved out here with his girl friend and they loved it here. He suggested the cougar trap for my wife (Maybe a prelude? lol) and a  Cable car for myself as well as telling us his favorite dish here being the Chicken & waffles and the Mac & Cheese. He was right on the money!!. We wondered about the room and it is a beauty!.  It has this old rat pack kinda style to it. lots of reds and the cocktails dresses wow!! Classy! our cocktail was wonderful! Then the DJ came on and it turned into a really cool funky nightclub.   The only reason I'm giving it 4 instead of 5 stars is cause the Mac and cheese came out not so hot. But here came Derek again to save the day!!. He apologized and assured us that it was unusual and that he would remedy it right away! He took it away somewhere and not 5 mins later was back with hot mac & cheese.and cooked us a fresh batch himself (or so he said) now that is customer service!!

m4lfiT_qnxt9AsPigIriDA.review_text: I love this place the drinks were delicious.. I ordered the cats meow which was excellent it wasn't to strong and wasn't all watered down my boyfriend ordered the ghost machine which was pretty good as well.. The customer service was great.. There was a tall black gentleman at the door who I just fell in move with I can't think if his name at the moment but all in all I will return when I visit from Southern California again

M1tH_l8zFgTlmAmtKcJccQ.review_text: Came here with my BFF for some drinks with a view. The view is to die! So romantical! Definitely a great place for a date night (HINT, HINT) ;) We were seated at a table with the best view. It was so pretty!! They have drinks from way back in the 1800's. I am obsessed with the Old Hollywood era & the history of this place fascinates me. The old Sinatra music they played was the icing on the cake.   We ordered our drinks & because I can't stand the taste of alcohol I couldn't drink my drink so I ordered a glass of champagne. To our surprise a nice gentleman behind us with his wife bought our drinks. See,  this is why I love San Francisco so much... People are so nice!!!  Around 9:30 or 10 a DJ started to play some new & old R&B music & we wanted to dance sooo bad. But we were not about to give up our seats lol It was packed for a Wednesday night I was surprised. The crowd was perfect not to many old people not to many young. It was a good mix. We both said we would come back again.

jpJcZxxHZamhGz1OWs3HPQ.review_text: Came here on Valentine's Day with my boyfriend.  We got here around 6:30pm, I want to say.  We didn't have a reservation or anything, so we just sat at the bar.    All the staff people were very nice!  The guy near the entrance was very kind and our bartender was just as kind.  I ordered the Chartreuse Swizzle and my boyfriend got the Highland Buck.  The bartender was crackin' jokes with us and was really nice when I was asking him questions about what alcohol he was pouring in our drinks.    He made us our drinks in a few minutes and I was excited to try my Chartreuse Swizzle cause I had no idea what it was haha.  And boy was I mildly disgusted.  My drink had Velvet Falernum ...which apparently is made up of a bunch of herbs and things.  You can definitely taste all the herbs.  It was kind of gross, but this was my fault for choosing something with Falernum alcohol.  I'd avoid it unless you like your drink tasting like grass & herbs haha.  I drank it regardless, but I'd probably never get it again!   My boyfriend's drink was good.  There was nothing crazy in there and he liked it so it was a win.    We also ordered their chicken nuggets with honey mustard sauce.  They were delicious! Problem is they only give you 5 small ball-shaped nuggets (for $9 ._.)  I was a bit inebriated at this point from my herby drink and probably could have consumed more nuggets than I'd like to admit..but I stopped myself from ordering more haha.  After our nuggets, we moseyed on towards the dance floor where the view was.  It was a nice view.  I'd imagine sunset would be very nice here.  We didn't dance but we  watched people getting their groove on on the dance floor.    As we left, we saw that the guy near the entrance was charging a cover for entrance.  Not sure how much it was, but I guess if you get there early enough there's no cover!  I personally wouldn't want to come if there was a cover, but I had a really nice time, despite my poor choice in alcoholic beverage.

R0kmKT9hbEuzGRRRpHUGaA.review_text: WACK !!!!! I was there last night and pay for my drinks with a $100 bill and got $40 back on fake bills !!!!!! Wtf ??? Never going there again . It was dark for me to check my change . Thank you for nothing !!!!!!

GMY44WcTkOSIRR77SFsDCw.review_text: great view from up there.  soundsystem had great sound and DJ played disco beats old and new.  the crowd here is a real mix of old and older and odd and odder, with a few hotel guests coming up for a nightcap.  we had two vocka and tonic, bartender suggested chopin potato vodka (they don't serve Tito's), $25 before tip....  but we knew we were paying for the view.

pZ_IdDsiXDx9jhaHhWfeYA.review_text: Went here with some friends for a birthday trip in San Francisco. The view is great but it was hard to take any pictures from up there due to the loud speakers so you'll have to take my word for it. Drinks were expensive but the live band and DJ made the overall experience worth it. Better than any place in Monterey, that's for sure.   I'd love to visit in the day next time I'm in the city. Not a place to go to meet women. Starlight room is more of a date location. We had an expectation of dress code here, but people walked in in sandals and hooded sweatshirts... must be a California thing... I was slightly disappointed.  P.S. Don't expect a table unless you agree to a $300.00 bar tab!

AGraTma9eEgsiJFDIy6tbg.review_text: Finally!  After living in San Francisco for 5 years, I finally got to experience the bar/club of the (in)famous Harry Denton!  I can actually see the Starlight Room lights flashing from my place and have always been curious what it was like inside.  Last Saturday, we came here for a friend's birthday.  I looked at the drink menu online prior to arrival so I knew I wanted the drink called Devilish - a sweet combination of apple juice, vodka and ginger beer!  I quite liked it (although my bf thought the price of $10 was a little over-priced).  The entry cover was $10 too - we're not big club-goers, so oh well, we can stand to pay a bit of a cover every so often.    It was a hot day that day and with all the body heat and drinking, it was quite steamy in the Starlight Room.  We were tired and were getting slightly dehydrated so we headed out a little early.  Good times though and at least I finally got to experience this landmark bar & club.  Happy Birthday, Susan!!  Saturday night cover = $10 Devilish drink = $10

_HmVfjZizikfli0zzBd2vg.review_text: Starlight just had a million dollar renovation and it is more lavish then ever.  Now the room matches the million dollar view.  The drinks are haute couture of the whole mixology trend and the decor is reminiscent of times past in the most opulent design. Sunset cocktails with tasty bar bites make for a very romantic date.   San Franciscans it is time to revisit Harry Denton's Starlight Room.

rXvsM4vsvrhmLKXu10HRbQ.review_text: I went here with a friend for a drink and to check out the place and whilst I was impressed with the view I was disappointed with the fact that the place was full of blokes and not enough women. I was not out looking and besides I had my gorgeous friend with me who was attracting a lot of attention lol  The ambience here is nice and they charge a $5 cover charge and the drinks are super expensive like $12 for a gin and tonic. The dance floor has a beautiful view and mirrored ceiling and a disco ball which is cool. The DJ was ok but nothing exciting.   The place is a tad too dark for my liking  and once you start dancing you can feel the heat and I was sweating like crazy. They have a terrace but it was off limits and that made me feel claustrophobic.   I would probably come back here but given the choice I would go try other places first.

VGxBZA-2zJyaggTpHcQbkA.review_text: Eh...came here with a friend last Friday night. Got in for free because bouncer or hostess think I was hot. Anyways, when I got into the lounge, the first thing I got was a drink. Drinks are expensive but good. The music sucked!!! Wedding music??? Lol for instance Electric slide and 70s disco? I could see my filipino folks dancin into those music hahaha I was hoping that they play some Hiphop music to pop my booty on the dance floor :) also they played older music that reminded me from high school such as 50 cent "in da club" and seeing older people dancing into it. In addition, I believe that this lounge is more an older crowds since I have seen a lot of those mingling around. Therefore, not really my scene. Although, props for getting in for free and a table from that hostess or bouncer ;)

fSvOdnryI9FPJ2ylcsE2ig.review_text: FYI, they only allow one credit card per table. And there was a cockroach at our table. Wtf!
